subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Tullamore Dew 18 Year Old
description: A limited edition of fewer than 2500 bottles from Tullamore DEW, made up of 18-year-old whiskey that was finished in a complex combination of oloroso sherry, port, madeira and bourbon casks. It's a spicy dram with a rich seam of fruity flavour running through the middle.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name:
Tullamore Dew 12 Year Old
Special Reserve
description: A 12yo blended Irish whiskey from duty-free favourite Tullamore Dew, Special Reserve has been assembled from a mixture of bourbon and oloroso sherry casks.
subtitle: Irish Blended Whiskey

name: Tullamore Dew 14 Year Old
description: A single malt released under the Tullamore DEW label, triple distilled in the Irish tradition and then finished in a range of different casks: bourbon, oloroso sherry, port and madeira. The result is a complex and spicy whiskey with creamy and fruity notes.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Tullamore Dew
description:
Tullamore Dew is a resoundingly popular Irish blend, particularly in overseas markets, where it is second only to Jameson. Very approachable.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name:
Tullamore Dew Specially Light
Bot.1970s
description:
An unusual bottle of Tullamore Dew from the 1970s, when having very light whiskey was what everyone wanted.


Please note


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Two Stacks Smoke & Mirrors Peated Single Malt Stout Cask
description: A peated Irish whiskey from Two Stacks that has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-imperial stout casks, creating a complex, well-balanced character. Aromas of honeydew melons, sweet barley, rhubarb, peach, toffee and soft peat smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of honey, dry peat, white peaches, dark chocolate and creamy vanilla throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whisky

name: Two Stacks The Blender's Cut Sauternes Cask Finish
description: A limited-edition Irish whiskey from Two Stacks that was initially matured in a combination of virgin oak, ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks, before being finished in a single French oak cask that previously held Sauternes wine from Bordeaux. The palate offers notes of honeysuckle, cinnamon, nutmeg and crystalised ginger.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Two Stacks The Blender's Cut Cask Strength
description: A sweet and spicy cask strength blended Irish whiskey from Two Stacks, The Blenders Cut is made with a combination of grain, malt and pot still whiskies, including a small amount of peated malt whiskey, matured in a combination of virgin oak, ex-bourbon and ex-oloroso sherry casks.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whisky

name: Two Stacks The First Cut
description: A sweet and spicy blended Irish whiskey from Two Stacks, The First Cut is made with a combination of grain, malt and pot still whiskies, including a small amount of peated malt whiskey, matured in a combination of virgin oak, ex-bourbon and ex-oloroso sherry casks.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Tyrconnell Single Malt
description:
A superb Irish single malt, with a creamy character and a wonderfully smooth palate. Very drinkable.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Whisky Agency Irish Malt 1989
27 Year Old for TWE
description: A very limited run of gorgeous, long-aged Irish whiskey, bottled exclusively for us by The Whisky Agency. The late 80s and early 90s were a sweet spot for whiskey from this anonymous Irish distillery, with a huge amount of fruity flavour in every bottling. This one zeroes in on mangoes, and is one of the juiciest drams we've ever tried. A must-taste for fans of the style.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whiskey
The Whisky Agency

name: Waterford Gaia Organic 2.1
description: Batch 2.1 of Waterford's Gaia Organic Irish single malt whiskey is part of a series which champions farmers that are growing barley with sustainable methods that respect the land and prioritise flavour over yield. Gaia Organic 2.1 is made with barley harvested in 2016 and offers aromas of orange peel, freshly-baked bread, milk chocolate, fig rolls, lavender, marshmallows and buttermilk that fill the nose, complemented by notes of white pepper, grapefruit, liquorice, cherries, dark chocolate, toast, peaches and lemon zest throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Waterford The Cuvee
description: Hotly anticipated single malt from Waterford. The terroir focused operation began work in 2014, filling casks with spirit distilled from barley grown at individual farms around Ireland. With this landmark release, the Waterford team have drawn on their mature stocks of single origin whisky and married them together, balancing the flavours derived from different terroirs to create depth and balance. The result is a characterful dram, oily in texture and slightly spicy with gingerbread and clove alongside fresh apple, marmalade and toasted grains.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name: Waterford Hook Head 1.1
description: Hook Head 1.1 is part of Waterford's Single Farm Origin series and is made exclusively with Irish Propino barley from Hook Head farm's 2015 harvest. Matured in a variety of casks, including first-fill bourbon barrels, virgin American oak and French oak casks for three years and eight months.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Luna 1.1 Biodynamic
description: One for the history books: this is the first single malt ever to be made from biodynamic barley. The approach to framing proposed by Rudolf Steiner treats a piece of land and the crops thereon as a single organism to be kept healthy and harmonious. This ground-breaking dram is remarkably vibrant and expressive, showing white fruit, wildflower honey and citrusy notes of farmhouse ale on the nose. The perfumed notes then gives way to a palate of apple pie, lemon zest and stony minerality.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name: Waterford Lakefield 1.1
description: The first release of Lakefield Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford is part of its Single Farm Origin range. Made with barley harvested in 2016, Lakefield 1.1 was matured in a variety of casks for three and a half years before being bottled. The palate offers notes of apple crumble, stewed rhubarb and clove that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Grattansbrook 1.1
description: An Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford's Single Farm Origin series, made exclusively with barley from Grattansbrook farm and matured for three years in a variety of casks. Aromas of marzipan, white grapes and lemon zest fill the nose, complemented by notes of raisins, chocolate spread, brown sugar, orange zest, cinnamon, ginger and banana throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name: Waterford Ballymorgan 1.2
description: The second release of Ballymorgan Single Farm Origin Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford is made exclusively with barley grown by Robert Milne in County Wexford. Fruity aromas of orange, mango and treacle fill the nose, complemented by notes of cinnamon, nutmeg and fresh malt on the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Sheestown 1.2
description: A Single Farm Origin single malt Irish whiskey from Waterford, Sheestown 1.2 is made exclusively with barley grown by Phillip O'Brien in Sheestown, Kilkenny. Softly spiced aromas of cinnamon, black pepper and cooked pears fill the nose, complemented by notes of malted barley, vanilla, apples and caraway throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Gaia Organic 1.1
description: The first organic Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford, Gaia 1.1 is made using 100% organic barley grown on seven different farms in Ireland. It has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon, virgin American oak, French oak and Vin Doux Naturel wine casks creating a fruity, spicy character.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Ballymorgan 1.1
description: The barley used to make Waterford Ballymorgan 1.1 Single Farm Origin Irish whiskey was grown in County Wexford, just an hour away from the distillery and matured in a combination of French and American oak casks.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Sheestown 1.1
description: Sheestown 1.1 is a single farm origin Irish whiskey from Waterford, made with barley grown just outside of the historic town of Kilkenny. Matured in a combination of French and American oak casks.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Ballykilcavan 1.2
description: Ballykilcavan Edition 1.2 from Waterford is made with 100% Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in County Laois. Distilled in 2016 and matured in a combination French and American oak casks for three months longer than Edition 1.1.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Bannow Island 1.2
description: Part of the second wave of whiskies from Waterford, Bannow Island 1.2 is made using barley grown on the extreme southern coast of County Wexford by Ed Harpur. Aromas of pears, green apples, salted toffee, toasted barley and vanilla on the nose, as well as vanilla, white grapes and white pepper. The palate offers notes of apple crumble, cinnamon, toffee, lime zest and ginger, followed by butterscotch, white grapes and white pepper.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Ballykilcavan 1.1
description: One of two inaugural releases from Waterford in Ireland, a distillery dedicated to showcasing the character that different farms and their terroir can give to whisky. Ballykilcavan farm is in the middle of a wood, with rich soil and protection for wind perfect for growing barley. The resulting whisky is punchy and sweet, run through with fruit and spicy grain.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Bannow Island 1.1
description:
One of the inaugural releases from Ireland's Waterford distillery, focusing on the differences in soil and terroir across the country. Bannow Island Edition 1.1 is made from barley grown by the sea, with the grain battered by salty breezes as it grows. Unsurprisingly it has a touch of brininess as part of its layered, complex and easy-drinking character.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: West Cork Bog Oak Charred Cask
description: A triple distilled single malt Irish whiskey from West Cork Distillers, initially matured in ex-sherry casks and finished in charred bog oak casks. These casks are made using oak sourced from the local boglands of Glengarriff. Aromas of warm spice, leather and dried fruit fill the nose, complimented by notes of malt, cracked black pepper and baking spices throughout the palate.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: West Cork Black Cask
description: A well-balanced blended Irish whiskey from West Cork Distillers, Black Cask is aged in first-fill bourbon casks for three years and finished for a further year in heavily charred bourbon casks. The palate is a balance of black pepper spice, creamy vanilla, fiery ginger and caramel, with hints of orange lingering in the finish.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Writers Tears Ulysses
description: A limited-edition blended Irish whiskey from Writers Tears, Ulysses commemorates the centenary of James Joyce's Ulysses and is presented in a stylish bottled designed by Studio Minerva, London. Aromas of apple, vanilla, honey and pot still spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of ginger, butterscotch, toasted oak, milk chocolate and toasted almonds throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Writers Tears Red Head
description: A fruity single malt Irish whiskey from Writer's Tears, Read Head is matured exclusively in oloroso sherry casks, creating aromas of candied orange peel, chocolate covered marzipan, dried fruit and praline that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of rich nuts, Christmas cake, tangy pineapple, liquorice and melted milk chocolate, with walnuts and baking spice lingering in the finish.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Writers Tears Copper Pot
description: Writers Tears Copper Pot Blend is a combination of pure pot still and malt whiskeys from an unnamed Cork distillery. Jim Murray gave this one 93 points.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Writers Tears Double Oak
description: Writers Tears Double oak marries both single malt and single pot still whiskies that have been matured in American oak casks and French oak Cognac casks from France's Allary Cooperage. Aromas of stewed fruits, earthy vanilla and apple crumble fill the nose, complemented by notes of white peaches, lychee, lemon peel, grapes and dark chocolate throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Yellow Spot 12 Year Old
description:
A second entry into the 'Spot' range, aged for 12 years and made up in part from spirit matured in Malaga casks for a sweet and moreish dram.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle:
Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name: American Barrels Bourbon
description:
Produced in Charleston, South Carolina, this eye-catching bottle of bourbon 'embodies two things Americans hold dear – whiskey barrels and gun barrels.' The top half of the bottle is glass and has a rattlesnake wrapped around it, evocative of the Gadsden flag that was designed by General Gadsden during the 1775 American Revolution.


Celebrating shots of all kinds, American Barrels is a small batch bourbon made from 60% corn, 36% rye and 4% malted barley. It has rich caramel aromas, underscored with vanilla and sizzling spice, with the palate reveals a youthful yet balanced bourbon with a caramel and oak finish.
subtitle: Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Angel's Envy Bourbon
Port Finish
description: An interesting bourbon with a unique twist - after the initial maturation it takes a leaf out of Scotch Whisky's book and spends between 3 and 6 months finishing in port barrels. The more experimentation the better, we reckon, especially when it turns out something like this - marrying the sweet caramel and grain of bourbon with the rich sticky wine flavours of a port cask.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Balcones Brimstone
description: A smokey spirit with a difference. Firstly it's made in Texas by Balcones and secondly the smoke comes from a secret process involving Texas Scrub Oak. This is not smoky whisky like you've had before – a mix of campfires, fruit and youthful corn.
subtitle: Texas Spirit

name: Balcones Texas Single Malt Whisky
description: A single malt whisky made in Texas by craft distilling powerhouse Balcones. It appeared in July 2011 and has been picking up awards ever since.
subtitle: Texas Single Malt Whisky

name: Balcones Texas Rye Whisky
description: Balcones introduced their 100% Rye Mashbill with Elbon Rye from Northwest Texas, and also includes crystal, chocolate and roasted rye. It is distilled in copper pot stills, which creates a full-bodied style of rye whiskey.
subtitle: Texas Rye Whiskey

name:
Balcones 2016
4 Year Old Simply Whisky Dream Big
description: A 2016 Balcones American corn whiskey from Simply Whisky, matured for four years in a refill bourbon barrel before being bottled in December 2020.
subtitle:
American Single Corn Whiskey
Simply Whisky

name: Balcones Baby Blue Corn Whisky
description:
Made from roasted blue corn (a type of flint corn, like sweet corn, but with a distinctive blue colour). This received the prestigious Double Gold medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition and has butter, corn, spice and fruit notes, alongside a rounded nuttiness.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Texas Corn Whisky

name: Balcones Pot Still Bourbon
description: A bold, flavour-forward Texan pot still bourbon from Balcones, matured in charred oak casks, creating aromas of honeycrisp apples, toasted oak, popcorn, savoury crackers and well-oiled leather that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of honey, vanilla cream, roasted pecans, sandalwood and leather that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Texas Straight Bourbon Whisky

name: Very Old Barton 100 Proof Bourbon
description: A Kentucky Straight Bourbon from Barton Brands, part of the Sazerac company since 2009, produced at the Tom Moore distillery in Bardstown Kentucky. Packed full of corny flavour (with a 75% corn mash) it's a standard across Kentucky.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Basil Hayden's Bourbon
description:
Created in 1796 by Basil Hayden, who went against the grain (no pun intended) by adding in rye into the traditional corn-based mashbill. It was a huge hit and today is one of Jim Beam's 'Small Batch' range of bourbons.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Benchmark No. 8 Straight Bourbon
description: Benchmark is a rye-recipe Kentucky straight bourbon from the Buffalo Trace distillery, awarded 90 points by Wine Enthusiast and a former Gold Medal and Trophy winner at the International Spirits Challenge.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Bernheim Original
description:
Bernheim Original is made by Heaven Hill and is the only straight wheat American whiskey available. A winner of the Gold 'Editor's Choice Award' from Whisky Magazine with a score of 17.75 out of 20 from Dave Broom & Michael Jackson, Bernheim is 51% winter wheat, 39% corn and 10% barley malt. A soft, mellow, fruity palate with gentle vanilla notes.

Tasting Notes (5)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Wheat Whiskey

name:
Biltmore Pure Rye Whiskey
Bot.1920s Hiram Walker
description:
This Canadian rye whiskey was bottled in the 1920s by Hiram Walker & Sons.


Please note


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
subtitle: Canadian Pure Rye Whiskey

name: Blood Oath Bourbon Pact No.5
description: Released in 2019 Blood Oath Bourbon Pact No. 5 is a combination of three different whiskies - a 13-year-old bourbon, and 11-year-old wheated bourbon and an eight-year-old bourbon that has been finished in Caribbean rum casks. This has created notes of black pepper, dark chocolate, vanilla, honey, orange, brown sugar and warm spices on the palate.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Booker's Bourbon
6 Year Old Donohoe's Batch
description:
Booker Noe first released his signature bourbon in 1992. This 2021 bottling is named in hour of former employee, and close friend of Booker Noe, Mike Donohoe, who was instrumental in the brand's creation.


Bottled straight from the barrel, unfiltered and without additions, this is bourbon at its purest. Aged for 6 years, 11 months and 4 days, it has notes of vanilla, toasted nuts and hints of baking spices.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Boondocks 8 Year Old Bourbon
Port Cask Finish
description: A bold 8-year-old bourbon from highly-rated Boondocks, this is a flavourful whiskey lent an impressive depth of character by its finishing in port pipes. Think rich, smooth bourbon flavour run through with oaky vanilla, a whiff of smoke and ribbons of red fruit. Complex and satisfying, it’s fantastic on its own or in a bourbon cocktail.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Boondocks 3 Year Old Straight Rye
description: A three-year-old straight rye whiskey from Boondocks, matured in virgin American oak casks to create layers of caramel, vanilla, toffee, fresh grass and white pepper throughout the palate.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name:
Boondocks 11 Year Old
Cask Strength
description: A complex cask-strength American whiskey from Boondocks, this was aged for 11 years. Earthy and spicy with notes of cereal, milk chocolate and leather.
subtitle: American Whiskey

name: Boondocks 11 Year Old
description: A blend of corn, malt and rye, this American whiskey is creamy with notes of butter, toasted marshmallows, fruit and exotic spice.
subtitle: American Whiskey

name: Bourbon Deluxe 4 Year Old
description: A four-year-old straight bourbon produced by Jim Beam at their distillery in Clermont, Kentucky. This young bourbon is versatile and can either be drunk neat, as part of a long drink or in cocktails.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Bower Hill Reserve Rye
description: Bower Hill Reserve is a classic American rye, with lots of spice to complement vanilla, orange and apricot flavours. This is superb either on the rocks or in a cocktail.
subtitle: Straight Rye Bourbon Whiskey

name: Breckenridge Straight Bourbon
description: A fruity, spicy bourbon from Brekenridge that offers aromas of green bananas, brown sugar, white pepper and toasted sesame seeds throughout the nose. The palate is light and creamy, with notes of sweet oak, vanilla and a slight bitter-spice, reminiscent of toasted rye bread with honey.
subtitle: None

name: Buffalo Trace Bourbon
description: Buffalo Trace is a really classy bourbon from the eponymous distillery that has been responsible for some truly outstanding products in recent years. A must-stock for any bar worthy of the name and probably the best all-rounder at the price
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Buffalo Trace White Dog Straight Rye
description: An unaged rye spirit from Buffalo Trace Distillery, White Dog Rye Mash pays homage to the first spirits made by settlers in America, known as White Dog, which would later become whiskey. The palate is fresh and green, with spicy rye notes and sweet, creamy cereals.
subtitle:
Unaged American Spirit
Distillery Bottling

name:
Buffalo Trace White Dog Mash 1
Half Bottle
description: The fad for distilleries releasing their new make spirit continues, this time in the form of Buffalo Trace's 'White Dog', the affectionate name given to unaged whiskey. Competitively-priced and attractively packaged, we reckon that Buffalo Trace's extra style credentials could well see this becoming a hit cocktail ingredient.
subtitle: Unaged American Spirit

name: Bulleit '95' Rye
description: A rich and spicy rye whiskey, with one of highest rye ratios (95%) we've seen. Loaded with fruit and spice, it's a terrific rye for the price, and is just as tasty sipped neat as it is served in your favourite whiskey cocktail.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Bulleit Bourbon Whiskey
description:
Packaged in an old-style bottle, Bulleit whiskey has developed a loyal following in the UK. The high rye content (around 30%) gives this bourbon a spicy kick.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Bulleit 10 Year Old Bourbon
description: Launched in 2013 in the USA, Bulleit's 10 Year Old Bourbon is now available on these shores. Rich and spicy with notes of vanilla, cinnamon and dried fruit, this is excellent value.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Catoctin Creek Roundstone Rye
80 Proof
description: The flagship whiskey of Virginia's Catoctin Creek – Roundstone Rye is the state's most awarded rye whiskey. Distilled from locally sourced organic ingredients at the Purcelville distillery, it's an old-fashioned rye whiskey with heaps of spice and toffee as well as a touch of citrus.
subtitle: American Rye Whisky

name:
Catoctin Creek Roundstone Rye
80 Proof
description: A sweet and spicy 100% rye whiskey from Virginia's Catoctin Creek, that is made at the Purcelville distillery using locally-sourced organic grain. Matured in American white oak casks, it offers notes of caramel, butter toffee, vanilla, lemon zest, ginger and white pepper throughout the palate.
subtitle: American Rye Whiskey

name:
Catoctin Creek Roundstone Rye
Cask Strength
description: This award-winning Virginian rye whiskey from Catoctin Creek is dark and rich, with plenty of spice in the form of aniseed and pepper. There’s also notes of toasty oak, toffee and candied citrus. Bottled at cask strength of 58%, a little water will unlock even more aromas and flavours.
subtitle: American Rye Whisky

name: Catoctin Creek Roundstone Rye 92
description: This award-winning rye whiskey from Virginia’s Catoctin Creek offers plenty of spice, along with toasty oak, a hint of mint and ginger. Bottled at 92° proof (46% ABV) for more punch and robustness. Use this in place of bourbon for a spicier take on your favourite whiskey cocktails.
subtitle: American Rye Whisky

name: Cedar Ridge Single Malt
description: A single malt whiskey from Iowa, made using two-row pale barley and matured in a range of casks, including wine barrels from Cedar Ridge Winery. Aromas of toffee apples, heather honey, pears and caramelised walnuts fill the nose, complemented by notes of leather, vanilla, oak, dark chocolate, red cherries and blackberries.
subtitle: American Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Coppersea Rye Batch 1
3 Year Old Boutique-y Whsiky Company
description: Coppersea is based in the Hudson Valley in New York, they grow and malt their own grain. This is a 100% rye whiskey and this is definitely not a shy and retiring Rye. With a lovely punchy spice and cherry wood, linseed oil notes, this is a distillery to keep a close eye on.
subtitle:
American Rye Whisky
That Boutique-y Whisky Company

name:
Copperworks 3 Year Old
Batch 1 That Boutique-y Whisky Company
description: A three-year-old Copperworks American single malt from That Boutique-y Whisky Company, matured in virgin American oak casks. Aromas of apples, sweet oak and green spices fill the nose, complemented by notes of skittles, cask char and honey on the palate.
subtitle:
Single Malt American Whisky
That Boutique-y Whisky Company

name: Corsair Wry Moon American Rye Spirit
description: An unaged small batch rye spirit from Corsair, designed for cocktails, distilled using the distillery's antique wash still and handmade pot still, and packed full of peppery spice.
subtitle: None

name: Daddy Rack Tennessee Straight Whiskey
description: A small batch bourbon from Daddy Rack, made with a high corn mash bill and matured in Virgin American oak barrels. Aromas of maple, honey, oak spice and caramelised banana fill the nose, complemented by notes of roasted apples, smooth butter, banana, vanilla, nutmeg and salted popcorn throughout the palate.
subtitle: Sour Mash Tennessee Straight Whiskey

name: Driftless Glen Small Batch 4 Year Old Bourbon
description: A small batch bourbon from Wisconsin's Driftless Glen distillery, made using a mashbill of 60% corn, 20% rye and 20% malted barley, and matured in virgin American oak barrels until it was bottled at four-years-old. Aromas of charred oak, soft spice and vanilla fill the nose, complemented a creamy texture and notes of caramel, vanilla, cinnamon, milk chocolate and red berries throughout the palate.
subtitle: Wisconsin Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Driftless Glen Small Batch 4 Year Old Rye
description: A four-year-old rye whiskey from Driftless Glen distillery in Wisconsin, USA, that was made with a mash-bill of 75% rye and 25% malted barley, then matured in virgin American oak barrels. Aromas of salted caramel, star anise and milk chocolate fill the nose, complemented by notes of rye spice, caramel, cloves, ginger, cinnamon and chocolate throughout the palate.
subtitle: Wisconsin Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Duke Bourbon
description: Duke Bourbon is aged for at least five years in heavily charred American-oak barrels. Made by friends of John 'The Duke' Wayne's son, this is sweet with notes of vanilla and toffee.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Bourbon Whiskey
Dumangin Batch 10
description: The 10th batch of smooth, sweet bourbon whiskey bottled by Specialites Dumangin J. Fils offers notes of vanilla, white pepper, sticky caramel and crunchy toffee apples.
subtitle: Dumangin

name:
Bourbon Whiskey
Ratafia Finish Dumangin Batch 005
description: Batch 005 of Bourbon whiskey from indie bottler Dumangin has been finished in a Ratafia cask and bottled in January 2020.
subtitle: Dumangin

name: E. H. Taylor Single Barrel
description:
Named after the founding father of the bourbon industry, Colonel Edmund Haynes Taylor. This single barrel bourbon is aged inside warehouses which he built and the brand is owned by Buffalo Trace.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: E. H. Taylor Small Batch
description:
Named after the founding father of the bourbon industry, Colonel Edmund Haynes Taylor. This small batch bourbon is aged inside warehouses which he built and the brand is owned by Buffalo Trace.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle:
Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name: Eagle Rare 10 Year Old
description: A top-quality bourbon from Buffalo Trace, the Eagle Rare 10yo is deliciously fragrant and woody, and has to be one of the best bargains available in this price range.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Elijah Craig 12 Year Old Barrel Proof
(68.3%)
description: A sweet and spicy barrel proof (cask-strength) bottling of Elijah Craig at 68.3%. Aged for a minimum of 12 years, this has notes of caramel, vanilla, pepper and mint.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Elijah Craig Small Batch
description: The replacement for the hugely popular Elijah Craig 12 Year Old, this no age statement bourbon is created from spirit aged between eight and 12 years old. Notes of nuts, vanilla, coconut, dark fruit and caramel.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Elijah Craig 12 Year Old
description: "About as complete a bourbon aroma as you are likely to find...one of the most beautiful noses found anywhere in the world today. A bourbon to keep in the mouth forever." Jim Murray
subtitle: Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Elmer T Lee 100 Year Tribute Single Barrel
description: A special release of Elmer T Lee Single Barrel bourbon from Buffalo Trace, celebrating what would have been the 100th birthday of Elmer T Lee, master distiller emeritus at Buffalo Trace.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Evan Williams Extra Aged
description: The extra aged version of Evan Williams's solid sipping whiskey, one of the biggest sellers in the USA behind the similar looking Old No. 7.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Evan Williams White Label
Bottled in Bond
description:
A bottle of Evan Williams' higher-strength white label at 100 proof. Evan Williams is revered as the first ever commercial distiller in Kentucky (he started in 1783). Today, the whiskey bearing his name is made by Heaven Hill and is the second-biggest bourbon brand in the US.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Ezra Brooks 99 Kentucky Straight Bourbon
description: A smooth, flavourful 99 Proof bourbon from Ezra Brooks, matured in Virgin American oak barrels and made with a rye-forward mash bill. The palate offers notes of caramel, vanilla, chocolate, green spice and creamy cereals that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Kentucky

name: Ezra Brooks Black Label Bourbon
description: Awarded 89 points by Wine Enthusiast magazine, this was originally designed to compete with Jack Daniel's, which it did so well that JD (unsuccessfully) sued. Nonetheless, it is still a great whiskey in its own right.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Ezra Brooks Straight Rye
description: A sweet and spicy straight rye whiskey from Ezra Brooks that offers hints of milk chocolate, leather, spicy grains and sweet oak.
subtitle: Indiana Straight Rye Whiskey

name: FEW Cold Cut Bourbon with Cold Brew Coffee
description: FEW Cold Cut is a combination of bourbon and cold brew coffee, offering aromas of vanilla, toffee, orange zest, apple and coffee beans on the nose. The palate offers notes of cinnamon, cloves, caramel, espresso and honey-nut cornflakes.
subtitle: None

name: FEW Bourbon
description: A three grain bourbon from Chicago's FEW distillery, combining the legally required corn majority with spicy rye and a bit of malt to get things going.
subtitle: None

name: FEW Rye
description: A rye whiskey from Chicago's FEW distillery, named for temperance campaigner Frances Elizabeth Willard. This is rye heavy, with a touch of corn in the mix. Aged in air-dried oak barrels, this is a spicy offering.
subtitle: American Rye Spirit Drink

name: FEW Immortal Rye
description: An unusually delicate rye whiskey from FEW, infused with 8 Immortals Oolong tea, creating notes of peach, honey and dragon fruit alongside grass, white pepper and ginger throughout the palate.
subtitle: American Rye Whiskey

name: FEW Single Malt Triple Smoke
description:
Made with barley smoked with cherry wood, mesquite wood and apple wood, this is a rich and oily American spirit with a distinctive smoky twang. Expect notes of apricot, apple, salty barbecue, toasted sugar and pastry, with a long savoury, smoky finish.


 FEW is a craft distillery based near Evanston, Illinois.
subtitle: None

name: FEW Single Barrel Bourbon
description: From FEW Spirits craft distillery in Illinois, this special-edition bourbon has been matured in a single barrel before being bottled at 101 proof. Sweet aromas of brown sugar, hot chocolate, honeycomb and oaky spice fill the nose. The palate offers notes of baking spices, white pepper, caramel, orange peel and chocolate that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Single Barrel Bourbon Whiskey

name: Few Flaming Lips Brainville Rye
description: A collaboration between FEW and rock band The Flaming Lips, this is a rye-heavy whiskey with notes of spice, oranges, and quince, with a herbaceous backbone.
subtitle: American Rye Whiskey

name: Four Roses Single Barrel Bourbon
description:
An outstanding single barrel bourbon from Four Roses. Beautifully balanced and smooth as silk, this is sweet, rich and potent with very appealing menthol notes, precious woods and delicious spices.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle: Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Four Roses Small Batch Bourbon
description:
A terrific small-batch bourbon from Four Roses – and in this case, Small Batch means just that – only four casks are used in the construction of each release. Sweet and spicy, with a generous dash of vanilla, this is a treat.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Four Roses Small Batch Select
description:
A fruity small-batch bourbon from Four Roses that is made with a combination of six out of the 10 recipes used by the distillery and matured for at least six years. Aromas of raspberries, cloves and nutmeg fill the nose, complemented by notes of ripe apricots, red berries, vanilla, peppery oak, spearmint and cinnamon throughout the palate and lingering in the finish.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Four Roses Small Batch Limited Edition
Bot.2019
description: The 2019-release of Four Roses Barrel Strength small-batch bourbon is a fruity whiskey with aromas of honey, oak, raspberries and vanilla. The palate offers notes of ripe berries, apples, cinnamon, baking spices and mellow toasted oak.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Four Roses Original (Yellow Label) Bourbon
Litre
description: Formerly known as Yellow Label, this is a very popular bourbon, aged a minimum of five years in oak barrels for extra smoothness and carefully blended for a consistently smooth, creamy flavour.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Four Roses Small Batch Limited Edition
Bot.2017
description:
The latest small batch bourbon from Four Roses, created from exceptional barrels. This 2017 limited edition, of which there are 3,000 bottles available, features warming notes of allspice, vanilla, apricots and red berries.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Four Roses Original
(Yellow Label) Bourbon
description:
Formerly known as Yellow Label, this is a very popular bourbon, aged a minimum of five years in oak barrels for extra smoothness and carefully blended for a consistently smooth, creamy flavour.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Four Roses Small Batch Limited Edition
Bot.2014
description:
2014's release of Four Roses Small Batch Barrel Strength is selected by the master distiller from the best barrels in the warehouses. Rich and spicy with an underlying sweetness.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Small Batch Straight Bourbon Whisky

name: Frey Ranch Bourbon
description: A spicy, sweet bourbon from Frey Ranch, made with a combination of corn, winter cereal rye, winter wheat and two-row barley grown in the Sierra Nevada Watershed. Aromas of orange, honey, cinnamon and candied peel fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, caramel, mint, banana, candy corn, hay and black pepper throughout the palate.
subtitle: Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
George Dickel 9 Year Old
Hand Selected Barrel
description: This whiskey is from George Dickel's private cask programme, which bottles individual barrels of nine-year-old and 14-year-old for individuals. Each bottle is hand labelled and signed by George Dickel's master distiller.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
George T Stagg 2003
Bot.2018
description: George T. Stagg bourbon has been aged for a minimum of 15 years in new-charred oak barrels, giving it a powerful and flavourful character. The palate holds plenty of toffee and dark chocolate flavours, with notes of vanilla and fudge. Hints of dates, red berries and tobacco mingle throughout the palate and linger on the finish alongside a hint of spearmint.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
George T Stagg
Bot.2015
description: The 2015 edition of the whiskey often seen as the pinnacle of the Buffalo Trace Antique Collection – George T Stagg. Bottled at 69.1%, this is packed full of intense flavour but isn't for the faint-hearted.
subtitle: Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
George T Stagg 2004
15 Year Old Bot.2019
description: The 2019 bottling of George T Stagg bourbon from Buffalo Trace distillery, a hearty whiskey aged in new charred oak casks for at least 15 years. Aromas of sweet toffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, nougat and molasses fill the nose. The palate offers notes of dates, tobacco, dark berries, spearmint and hints of coffee that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Heaven's Door Straight Rye
description:
A straight rye whiskey from Bob Dylan's Heaven's Door range, finished in toasted oak cigar barrels from Vosges, France. It is full of orange peel, bright tropical fruit, coriander and spice notes and has already won a clutch of gold medals at spirits competitions over the past two years.


The distinctive artwork on the bottle is a replica of metalwork crafted by Bob Dylan at his studio, Black Buffalo ironworks.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whisky

name: Heaven's Door Tennessee Bourbon
description:
A rich, sweet and spicy bourbon from – as you've probably guessed from the name – Bob Dylan. The Heaven's Door whiskey range is named after Dylan's song, Knockin' on Heaven's Door, but the slew of awards already picked up by each whiskey show that it's far from a gimmick. This bourbon, launched in 2018 and aged for at least eight years, has notes of vanilla, baked bread and toasted oak.


The intricate design on the bottle is modelled after a gate created by Dylan at his metalworking studio, Black Buffalo Ironworks.
subtitle: Tennessee Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Heaven's Door Double Barrel American Whiskey
description:
This blend of three different whiskeys is married in new American oak barrels and matured for an extra year before bottling at 100 proof. It has a complex palate of caramel, oak, citrus and spice notes, and a long finish.


Heaven's Door whiskeys were created by musician Bob Dylan, whose ornate iron gates (made himself from materials found all over America) are also the inspiration for the bottle's artwork.
subtitle: Tennessee Double Barrel Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Henebery Whiskey
Infused With Spices
description: Henebery is 90-proof rye whiskey infused with spices. The result is a spirit with notes of rye spice with citrus and floral notes.
subtitle: American Rye Whiskey

name: Henry McKenna
description: Medium-bodied, yet intensely flavoured, with a strong blast of spice amid the dark sugar and vanilla notes. "Magnificent stuff from Heaven Hill that really is worth hunting for." Jim Murray
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: High West Double Rye
description: A very special rye whiskey from High West's maverick David Perkins. This is a combination of a 2 year old 95% rye mashbill with a 16yo 53% rye mash and has gone down a storm in its home country, scoring 90 points from Malt Advocate's John Hansell.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: High West Rendezvous Rye
description: A no-age statement blended straight rye whiskey from Utah's High West Distillery Co., Rendezvous has already picked up a gold at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: High West Campfire
description: A collaborative whiskey from High West, taking spirit from the USA and Scotland to produce a one-of-a-kind bottling. It's a blend of straight bourbon and rye, with high corn and rye mashbills respectively, with a peaty Scottish single malt. A superb combination of sweet corn, floral rye and smoky Scotch.
subtitle: Blended Whiskey

name: High West American Prairie Bourbon
description: Another bottling by High West while their own spirit matures, showing off their ability to select great whiskeys. This is a blend of 6 and 13 year old bourbon produced in honour of the nascent American Prairie Reserve, an area the size of Connecticut that will hopefully one day be the largest grassland wildlife reserve in the USA.
subtitle: Straight Bourbon

name: Horse With No Name Bourbon with Habanero Spirit
description: An oaky, spicy bourbon-based spirit, Horse With No Name is made with a combination of yellow dent Texas corn, soft red winter wheat and six-row distiller's malt, and then blended with habanero chilli distillate to give it a fruity note.
subtitle: Bourbon Infused with Chilli Distillate

name:
Hudson Baby Bourbon
Tuthilltown Distillery Half Bottle
description: A half-bottle of the splendidly-named Hudson Baby Bourbon - the first legal aged grain spirit to be produced in New York since Prohibition ended over 75 years ago. Unusually for bourbon, Hudson's spirit is manufactured in a potstill at the Tuthilltown Gristmill (a heritage site) and is aged in small new oak casks.
subtitle: None

name:
I W Harper Gold Medal
Bot.1970s
description:
Please note


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
J W Dant
Charcoal Perfected
description: Charcoal Perfected is an old-style whiskey from JW Dant, made at Heaven Hill in Kentucky.
subtitle: None

name:
J. W. Dant 7 Year Old
Bot.1970s
description:
Please note


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Bonded
100 Proof Bottled-in-Bond
description: Jack Daniel's Bonded is a Bottled-in-Bond whiskey, meaning that it was distilled by a single distiller, during a single season, matured in a government bonded warehouse for at least four years and bottled at 100 proof. The palate offers notes of caramel, oak spice, vanilla, baking spices and a hint of smoke that lingers in the finish.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name: Jack Daniel's 100 Proof Bottled-in-Bond Tennessee Whiskey
description: Originally available only in travel retail, this bottled-in-bond expression from Jack Daniels comes to you at 100 proof, for a fuller body and more concentrated flavours. The distillery’s signature notes of banoffee pie and maple syrup are accompanied by russet apple and toasted peanuts. A must-have for any Jack Daniel's fan.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select Nosing Glass Gift Set
(45%)
description:
A handsome gift box from Jack Daniels, containing a bottle of its Single Barrel Select and a Jeff Arnett nosing glass to enjoy this whiskey's robust and complex character.


Jeff Arnett was Jack Daniel's seventh master distiller, moving into the role in 2008 after having joined the distillery team in 2001.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Legacy Sour Mash
Edition 3
description: A special limited-edition bottle of Jack Daniel's, celebrating a not-often discussed part of the whiskey's history: the days when it had a bright green and gold label. Back before 1904 this is what bottles of Jack looked like, although the distillery claim to have lost all records about why it looked like this. In the bottle, it's Old No.7, but at 43% ABV, giving it a more punch than the regular release. A must for collector's and fans of Jack Daniel's classic Tennessee style.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Old No. 7
Guitar Case
description: A bottle of Jack Daniel's Old No. 7, presented in a whimsical guitar case. The original all-conquering cola-friendly colossus, Jack Daniel's No. 7 commands a legion of fans worldwide, thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select
description:
Single Barrel Select is the logical next step for any fan of the signature Jack Daniels flavour profile. With its higher ABV of 45% (90 proof) you’ll experience those classic caramel, oak-spice and fruity sweetness in higher definition, with a slight increase in punch that’s sure to hold your attention.


With each batch drawn from a single barrel of Jack Daniels, Single Barrel Select is a particularly pure expression of a whisky adored all over the world – a must-try for JD enthusiasts and, indeed, American whiskey fans at large.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle: Single Barrel Tennessee Whiskey

name: Jack Daniel's 2011 Birthday Edition Whiskey
description: The 2011 special edition of Jack Daniel's, bottled in honour of Mr Daniel's 161st birthday. This is their controversial changed bottle shape with a black wrap, the first of the new bottles that we've had in.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select
Litre Bottle
description:
A special edition from Jack Daniel's, celebrating one of the whiskey's biggest fans – Frank Sinatra. For more than 50 years, JD was a firm favourite of Ol' Blue Eyes, regularly appearing in his hand as a tipple of choice. This release is not only bottled at a stronger 45%, but is also partly matured in 'Sinatra barrels', grooved on the inside to allow more wood/spirit interaction, developing a deeper and more intense flavour.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select
Tin Cage
description: A bottle of Jack Daniel's Single Barrel – a richer variation of Jack Daniels, with less sweetness and more power than the No.7 – presented in a stylish tin cage. A favourite in bars, this is a must for aficionados.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name: Jack Daniel's Master Distiller No 6
description: The sixth release in Jack Daniel's Master Distiller series is named after James Howard Bedford, who was Master Distiller at Jack Daniel's between 1988 and 2008, using his experience as a farmer as well as a distiller to create sweet and spicy whiskey.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name: Jack Daniel's White Rabbit Saloon
description:
Originally released to commemorate the 120th anniversary of the opening of Jack Daniel's White Rabbit Saloon in Lynchburg, this special edition is now enjoying a more general release. The same great JD taste, but at a higher strength.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Gentleman Jack
 Jack Daniel's
description:
Twice run through Jack Daniels’ trademark maple-charcoal filtration, Gentleman Jack is the statesman of the Jack Daniels range. Exhibiting an impressive mellow quality and a fullness of flavour at once bold and refined, Gentleman Jack is filled with flavours of fresh vanilla, sweet caramel and spicy oak – a universal favourite at the absolute peak of its maturity.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Legacy Sour Mash
Edition 2
description: The second edition of Jack Daniel's Legacy Sour Mash limited-edition whiskey features one of the very first predominantly black labels. In the bottle, it's Old No.7, but at 43% ABV it has slightly more punch than the regular release. A must for collectors and fans of Jack Daniel's classic Tennessee style.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name: Jack Daniel's Legacy Edition Sour Mash
description: A special limited-edition bottle of Jack Daniel's, celebrating a not-often discussed part of the whiskey's history: the days when it had a bright green and gold label. Back before 1904 this is what bottles of Jack looked like, although the distillery claim to have lost all records about why it looked like this. In the bottle, it's Old No.7, but at 43% ABV, giving it a more punch than the regular release. A must for collector's and fans of Jack Daniel's classic Tennessee style.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name: Jack Daniel's Tennessee Straight Rye
description: Welcome to the first new Jack Daniel's whiskey since before Prohibition. Tennessee Straight Rye is made from 70% rye, 18% corn and 12% malted barley, and is put through the same charcoal filtration process as Jack Daniel's bourbons. The result is a mellow and sweet whiskey that's enlivened with distinctive rye spice.
subtitle: None

name: Jack Daniels Master Distiller No 5
description: The fifth edition of Jack Daniel's range of whiskey's honouring the company's master blenders. The fifth edition takes us all the way to the 1970s, and is bottled for the excellently named Frank Bobo. He helped build Jack Daniel's reputations through both the 70s and 80s, helping it to become the worldwide powerhouse it is today.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select Nosing Glass Pack
(47%)
description: A gift pack that includes a bottle of Jack Daniel's Single Barrel – a richer variation of JD, with less sweetness and more power than the No.7 – as well as a nosing glass. A favourite in bars, this is a must for aficionados.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Single Barrel
Barrel Strength
description: A full-bodied cask strength single barrel Tennessee Whiskey from Jack Daniel's that offers aromas of oak spice, honey, smoke and walnuts on the nose. The palate offers notes of raisins, dried apple slices, cigar boxes and peppery spice that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Single Barrel Tennessee Whiskey

name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Rye
description: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Rye is the brand's first new mash bill in 150 years. The use of 70% rye adds extra spice to notes of ripe fruit and toast.
subtitle: Tennessee Rye Whiskey

name: Jack Daniel's Old No.7
description:
There's a strong argument to be made for Jack Daniel's Old No.7 being the most recognisable whiskey on the face of the earth, and you don't get that kind of recognition without good reason.


Made to a recipe dating back more than a century, painstakingly filtered through maple charcoal for purity and flavour, and then matured in charred oak barrels, the classic JD's sweet and oaky flavour has inspired generations of drinkers to enjoy whiskey.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name: Gentleman Jack Washbag Set
description: A sophisticated gift set from Jack Daniel's that includes a bottle of Gentleman Jack and a stylish leather washbag. Exhibiting an impressive mellow quality and a fullness of flavour, at once bold and refined, Gentleman Jack is filled with flavours of fresh vanilla, sweet caramel and spicy oak – a universal favourite at the absolute peak of its maturity.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Original
Double Magnum
description: One of the most recognisable whiskies in the world just got more eye-catching with this impressive double magnum bottle – that is to say, three-litre bottle – of Jack Daniel's Old No.7. Filtered through 10 feet of sugar maple charcoal, this Tennessee whiskey has a creamy character with a balance of sweet vanilla and soft oak spice throughout the palate.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Old No.7
Magnum
description: A magnum bottle of Jack Daniel's best selling old no.7 Tennessee Whiskey, famous worldwide thanks to the sweet smoothness imparted by the Lincoln County Process of charcoal-mellowing the spirit before maturation.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name:
Jack Daniel's Old No. 7
Small Bottle
description: A 20cl bottle of world-famous Jack Daniel's old no. 7. The same familiar taste and quality, just easier to carry on the move.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name: James Cree's Cattle Ranch 3 Year Old Bourbon
description: A three-year-old bourbon from James Cree's Cattle Ranch whiskey, made in Indiana with a mash-bill of 70% corn, 21% rye and 9% barley, and matured in virgin American oak barrels. Aromas of freshly-baked gingerbread and vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla ice cream, orange zest, oak spice and gingerbread biscuits throughout the palate.
subtitle: American Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: James Cree's Cattle Ranch 8 Year Old Bourbon
description: An eight-year-old bourbon from James Cree's, made in Indiana with a mash bill of 80% corn, 10% rye and 10% barley, and matured in virgin American oak barrels. Aromas of orange curd, buttery toast, caramel and peppercorn fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla fudge, milk chocolate, toasty oak, cinnamon, orange, cream and black pepper throughout the palate.
subtitle: Tennessee Bourbon Whiskey

name: James E Pepper 1776 Rye
description: A rye whiskey bottled under the reinvigorated James E Pepper label. James's grandfather has a claim to having opened the first Kentucky Distillery in 1776, but the James Pepper brand really hit its height in the early part of the 20th century, although it had disappeared by the latter parts. It's now back with this bourbon-esque, fruity rye whiskey.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: James Oliver Rye
description: James Oliver Rye is aged in heavily charred (alligator-charred) casks for four years. Bottled in Oregon, it displays classic rye whiskey spiciness.
subtitle: American Rye Whiskey

name: Jeptha Creed Straight Four Grain Bourbon
description: A sweet and spicy bourbon from Jeptha Creed, Straight Four Grain is made with a combination of 70% Bloody Butcher corn, 15% malted rye, 10% malted wheat and 5% malted barley. Aromas of vanilla cream, geraniums, hydrangea, dried apricots, red berries, peach cobbler and blackberry jam fill the nose, complemented by notes of nutmeg, clove, toasted pecans and mint throughout the palate.
subtitle: Straight Kentucky Bourbon Whiskey

name: Jim Beam Double Oak
description: Launched in 2016, Jim Beam Double Oak is aged in in not one, but two, new charred-oak barrels. This has all the classic sweetness and flavours of Jim Beam White Label, but with added spice.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Jim Beam Black 6 Year Old
Triple Aged
description: Jim Beam Black, the 'triple-aged' statement refers not to three different types of cask (as that would not be allowed under bourbon regulations) but to the 6 year old age statement, which is three times the minimum maturation period for straight bourbon.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Jim Beam White Label
description: Made to the same formula since 1795, this giant of the category is aged for four years in oak barrels to create a smooth, mellow taste with hints of spice.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Jim Beam Devil's Cut Bourbon
description:
A devilish twist on Jim Beam's regular bourbon, blending their 6 year old whiskey with spirit extracted from the wood of the cask itself, where it's soaked in over the years of maturation. This gives us a robust and hefty bourbon with a nice added chunk of woody richness.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Jim Beam Single Barrel
description: Not entirely unlike snowflakes, every bourbon barrel is different. Jim Beam Single Barrel Bourbon celebrates the individuality of each barrel and the flavours that they produce. It has the caramel, vanilla and oak notes that Jim Beam are known for, alongside unique, spicy flavours.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Jim Beam Rye
description: Made to one of Beam's oldest recipes, this release of rye whiskey is made in a pre-Prohibition style. Big, bold and spicy with notes of vanilla and black pepper.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Johnny Drum Green Label
description: An excellent-value four-year-old Kentucky straight, offering a very smooth but complex palate. One of the best inexpensive bourbons around.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Johnny Drum Black Label
description: Johnny Drum Black Lable is about 12 years old and made by a long running family of distillers who've kept things traditional over the years.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Kentucky Gentleman 4 Year Old
Bot.1970s
description:
Please note


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Kentucky Old Reserve Bourbon
description: A solid bourbon produced by, strangely, the folks of the Florida Caribbean Distilling company. They make rum and other spirits at their distillery in Florida, but this is made in Kentucky and selected by the company.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Kentucky Owl Wiseman Bourbon
description: The Wiseman is the first Kentucky Owl release from master blender John Rhea and is comprised of a four Straight bourbons matured for up to eight-years-old. Aromas of caramel, allspice, citrus and oak fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, caramel ice cream, baking spices and peppery oak throughout the palate.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Kentucky Owl Straight Bourbon
St Patrick's Edition
description: A limited-edition release of Kentucky Owl Straight Bourbon that was made in a collaboration between Kentucky Owl master blender John Rea and Louise McGuane, founder of JJ Corry Irish Whiskey. Decked out from head-to-toe in green for St Patrick's Day, it celebrates the age-old connection between American and Irish whiskey, and is made with a combination of casks aged between four and eight years old. The palate offers notes of vanilla caramel, crunchy apples, white pepper, orange peel, ginger and oak spice that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Kentucky Vintage Bourbon
description:
Kentucky Vintage is a small batch bourbon produced at the Willett distillery. A lighter, elegant style of bourbon that is also very complex. The versatility of this bourbon leads to it being able to be enjoyed equally well on its own or in a variety of cocktails.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Knob Creek 9 Year Old
description: A nine-year-old high-rye bourbon from Knob Creek that was relaunched in 2021 with a brand new presentation and the return of the age statement. Aromas of toasted nuts, sweet cereals and oak spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of ripe fruit on the palate.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Kopper Kettle Virginia Straight Bourbon Whiskey
Belmont Farm
description: Rich, full-flavoured Virginian bourbon bursting with notes of cocoa, vanilla, caramel and woody spice. Made from grain to bottle at Belmont Farms Distillery and bottled at a punchy 46% ABV, this would be ideal used in a classic bourbon cocktail.
subtitle: Virgina Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Kopper Kettle Virginia Whiskey
Belmont Farm
description: The first Kopper Kettle bottling from Belmont Farms Distillery is a delicious sipping whiskey. Made with three types of grain, it is rested on Virginia white-oak and apple-wood chips for two months before being aged in oak barrels for four years.
subtitle: Virginia Whiskey

name: Koval Rye Whiskey
description: A 100% rye whisky from Koval, Chicago's first distillery since Prohibition. Producing using locally sourced grain, this is aged in new Minnesotan oak and bottled from a single barrel.
subtitle: American Single Barrel Rye Whiskey

name: Koval Bourbon
description: Unusually, as well as the required minimum 51% corn, the rest of the mash contains gluten-free millet instead of the more-usual rye or wheat. A sweet and spicy release from Chicago's Koval.
subtitle: American Single Barrel Bourbon Whiskey

name: Koval Millet Whiskey
description: A 100% millet whisky from Koval, Chicago's first distillery since Prohibition. Producing using locally sourced grain, this is aged in new Minnesotan oak and bottled from a single barrel.
subtitle: American Single Barrel Millet Whiskey

name: Koval Rye Grain Spirit
description: Koval Rye Grain Spirit is a white dog from Chicago. With floral and peppery notes, this can be sipped neat or used in cocktails.
subtitle: American Grain Spirit

name: Koval Four Grain Whiskey
description: From Chicago's first distillery since Prohibition, this is produced from four types of grain – oat, malted barley, rye and wheat. Aged in heavily charred new Minnesotan oak, this is creamy and spicy.
subtitle: American Single Barrel Whiskey

name: Larceny 92 Proof
description: Produced by Heaven Hill, Larceny bourbon uses wheat as the secondary grain rather than rye. This gives it a smoother flavour than your average bourbon. Larceny is a small batch bourbon, made using no more than 100 barrels and bottled at a slightly higher 92 proof.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Legent Bourbon
