description: The 2011 bottling of Thomas H Handy's Sazerac, the multi-award winning straight rye and one of the cornerstones of Buffalo Trace's yearly Antique Collection releases. A vibrant and super-spicy rye that won World Whiskey of the Year in Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2013.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Tincup American Whiskey
description:
Tincup American Whiskey is the brainchild of Colorado-based Jess Graber. A distiller as a hobby for 30 years, he turned full-time in 2004. A high rye whiskey, made with a bourbon-style profile but more powerful and spicier, the cap also works as a cup.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: None

name: TX American Whiskey
description: An American blended whiskey from Texas's Firestone & Robertson Distilling Co., TX is a sweet, fruity whiskey with aromas of vanilla bean and ripe pears on the nose. The palate offers notes of butter, honey, vanilla bean and banana.
subtitle: Texas Blended Whiskey

name: Uncle Nearest 1884 Small Batch Whiskey
description: A small-batch whiskey from Uncle Nearest that is hand-selected by its founders and carefully curated by fifth-generation master blender Victoria Eady Butler. Buttery aromas of honey-covered toast, cereal and freshly-baked cookies fill the nose, complemented by notes of maple syrup, wood smoke, vanilla sponge and spring flowers throughout the palate.
subtitle: Tennessee Whiskey

name: Van Brunt Stillhouse Bourbon
description: A deliberate divergence from tradition, this is a big, bold bourbon built to satisfy your sweet tooth. Chocolate, butterscotch and hints of banana simmer down to a finish sprinkled with coffee, nuts and lashings of maple syrup. It's a sundae in a whiskey glass, and we love it.
subtitle: American Bourbon Whiskey

name: Van Brunt Stillhouse Rye Spirit
description: Enter: a particularly exciting aroma – look out for a flourish of fresh spring flowers on the nose. The palate is deeper, with chocolate and coffee notes lifted by a touch of spice and opening up into bright cherry Bakewell flavours toward the end. A vibrant rye whisky which would sit comfortably at the base of a Manhattan.
subtitle: American Rye Spirit

name:
Very Old Barton
86 Proof
description: The 43% release of Very Old Barton. Rich and sweet with notes of tropical fruits, vanilla, caramel and wood spice.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
William Larue Weller Bourbon 2007
 12 Year Old Bot.2019
description: The 2019 release of William Larue Weller bourbon from Buffalo Trace, distilled in 2007 and matured for 12 years in virgin American oak casks. Aromas of caramel popcorn, new leather, plums, light toffee and pipe tobacco fill the nose. The palate offers notes of marshmallow, salted almonds, nougat, figs and dates that linger in the finish.
subtitle:
Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whisky
Buffalo Trace Distillery

name:
William Larue Weller Bourbon 2006
Bot.2018
description: The 2018 release of Buffalo Trace distillery’s William Larue Weller bourbon has been aged for 12 years in lightly-charred, virgin-oak barrels. This wheated bourbon was bottled at cask strength and has rich flavours of dried fruits, figs and heady caramelised vanilla.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
William Larue Weller Bourbon 2005
Bot.2017
description:
The 2017 release of this popular wheated bourbon is a 12 Year Old with aromas of plums, pipe tobacco and caramel corn, alongside flavours of marshmallow, figs, dates and salted almonds.


This edition was released as part of the 2017 Buffalo Trace Antique Collection.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Walker's De Luxe
Hiram Walker Bot. 1980s
subtitle: Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Walker's American Rye Whisky 1925
Bot.1930s
description:
Please note


This is an old bottle and the closure may have deteriorated - care should be taken when it is being opened. The item is sold as described and we do not accept liability for the state of the closure.
subtitle: American Rye Whisky

name: War Eagle Whiskey
description: War Eagle is a fruity bourbon from Kentucky. With notes of vanilla, peach and wood spice, this is suited to cocktails.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Wathen's Single Barrel Bourbon
description: A single barrel bourbon from Wathen's, produced in Kentucky. The whiskey makers, the Wathen-Medleys, have a bit of history with the current distillers being the 8th generation of the family to be in the business.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Westland Garryana
2020 Release
description: The 2020 release of Westland Garryana, a fruity, spicy American whiskey from Westland distillery, finished in Garryana oak casks. Aromas of honey, vanilla cream, milk chocolate, wood smoke, raspberry compote and nutmeg fill the nose, accompanied by notes of savoury rye bread, clove, summer flowers and dry oak throughout the palate.
subtitle: American Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Westland Garryana
2021 Release
description: The 2021 release of Westland Garryana. This fruity, spicy American single malt is finished in casks made from precious Garryana oak – a unique species native to the northwestern United States. Aromas of vanilla and toasted coconut forefront deep notes of clove, dark chocolate, molasses and smoky barbecue sauce. Another great expression from the terroir-focused Washington distillery.
subtitle:
American Single Malt Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name:
Westland Peated Single Malt
Small Bottle
description: A 20cl bottle of Westland's peated malt. Made with a proportion of very heavily peated whisky combined with unpeated, aged in American oak. An excellent balance between smoke and fruit, with notes of earth, green herbs and roasted nuts.
subtitle: American Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Westland Garryana
2019 Release
description: The 2019 release of Westland Garryana, a fruity, spicy American whiskey from Westland distillery, finished in Garryana oak casks. Aromas of honey, vanilla cream, milk chocolate, wood smoke, raspberry compote and nutmeg fill the nose, accompanied by notes of savoury rye bread, clove, summer flowers and dry oak throughout the palate.
subtitle: American Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Westland Gift Set
3x20cl
description: This gift set from Seattle's Westland contains three 20cl bottles; one each of the classic American Single Malts, Peated and Sherry Oak. A great gift for whisky lovers who like to explore outside of Scotland.
subtitle: American Single Malt Whiskey

name: Westland Sherry Wood Single Malt
description:
Westland's sherried expression takes its inspiration from Scotch, but has an American feel. Rich and sweet with notes of maple syrup, raisins, cookies and stewed yellow fruits.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: American Single Malt Whiskey

name: Westland Peated Single Malt
description:
Westland's peated malt is made with a proportion of very heavily peated whisky combined with unpeated, aged in American oak. An excellent balance between smoke and fruit, with notes of earth, green herbs and roasted nuts.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: American Single Malt Whiskey

name: Westland American Oak Single Malt
description:
American Oak is Seattle-based distillery Westland's flagship release. Made with barley from Washington, this is rich and creamy with notes of chocolate custard, almond and bananas.


Seattle distillery Westland uses locally sourced ingredients to create American single malt whiskies that honour the tradition of American whiskey-making with a Pacific North West twist.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: American Single Malt Whiskey

name: Westward American Single Malt
description: An American single malt whiskey, made with locally grown and malted barley, and matured in lightly-toasted virgin American white oak casks. Fruity aromas of red berries, apples and pears mingle with creamy vanilla and brown sugar on the nose. The palate offers notes of baking spices, ripe fruit, sweet malt, tobacco, dark chocolate, oak spice and stone fruits that linger in the finish.
subtitle: American Single Malt Whisky

name:
Whiskey Thief Bourbon
3 Year Old
description: Whiskey Thief is an innovative bourbon from Indiana. Aged in new American-oak barrels with charred oak inserts, which increases the speed of maturation. Fruity and spicy with notes of vanilla and mocha.
subtitle: Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
WhistlePig Amburana Rye
12 Year Old TWE Exclusive
description:
A specially-selected whiskey bottled just for The Whisky Exchange. When we tried a sample of this rare amburana-matured whiskey, we immediately asked WhistlePig if we could have some as an exclusive, and after much begging they said yes. This 12-year-old Indiana-distilled rye whiskey was finished by WhistlePig in a a cask made of south-American amburana wood. It's very rarely seen in whisky-making, more commonly being used to age cachaca, and it adds a unique fragrant character to the whiskey that makes it like nothing else. A must-try for all fans of American whiskey.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: WhistlePig 10 Year Old Rye Whiskey
description: A hard-to-find, award-winning 100% rye whisk(e)y created by Maker's Mark's former master distiller, Dave Pickerell. Distilled and initially aged in Canada, before years of further ageing at WhistlePig farm in Vermont, this is, as owner Raj Bhakta puts it, 'a Canadian-US collaboration to the core'.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: WhistlePig 15 Year Old Estate Oak Rye Whiskey
description: When launched in 2016, this was the oldest release from Whistlepig. Made with predominantly Canadian rye, this is finished in toasted virgin-oak barrels which add extra spiciness to the toffee and caramel flavours.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: WhistlePig 12 Year Old Old World Rye Whiskey
description: WhistlePig 12 Year Old Rye Whiskey is aged in three types of cask from the 'old world'. 63% is aged in Madeira casks, 30% in Sauternes and 7% in Port. The spicy rye combines perfectly with the sweet flavours from the casks.
subtitle: American Rye Whiskey

name: WhistlePig PiggyBack 6 Year Old Rye
description: A six-year-old rye whiskey from WhistlePig, PiggyBack is made with 100% rye and matured in American oak barrels for six years before being bottled at 96.56 proof. Aromas of cinnamon, black pepper, grapefruit and tangerine fill the nose, complemented by notes of cocoa, cardamom, leather, nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla throughout the palate.
subtitle: American Rye Whiskey

name: WhistlePig Homestock Rye Crop 004
description: The fourth limited-edition release in WhistlePig's FarmStock series, HomeStock, was created during the world's first virtual crowd blending experience and is made with a combination of rye, wheat and barley whiskies. The palate offers notes of soft vanilla, rye spice, toffee apples and rich coffee.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: WhistlePig 18 Year Old
description: An 18-year-old rye whiskey from WhistlePig, made with a mash bill of 79% rye, 15% malted rye and 6% malted barley, creating a floral, earthy character. Sweet aromas of toasted oak, red berries and nutmeg fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of summer fruits, white flowers, vanilla, oak and crystalised ginger fill the palate, with a spicy undercurrent of green rye.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name:
WhistlePig 12 Year Old Marriage
 Old World Cask Finish
description: WhistlePig 12 Year Old Rye Whiskey is aged in three types of cask from the 'old world'. 63% is aged in Madeira casks, 30% in Sauternes and 7% in Port. The spicy rye combines perfectly with the sweet flavours from the casks.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Wild Turkey Longbranch
description:
A full-bodied and balanced bourbon, at once fresh, sweet and smoky, with a rich and rounded mouthfeel, Longbranch is a collaborative effort between Wild Turkey Master Distiller Eddie Russell and the brand's Creative Director – award-winning actor Matthew McConaughey.


Longbranch has been refined using charcoal from both Kentucky white oak and Texan mesquite in a nod to both mens' home states, and the bottle bears the signatures of both Russell and McConaughey in a nod to the spirit in which this bourbon was made – that of friendship and partnership.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Wild Turkey 101
description:
America's biggest-selling premium bourbon, the much-loved Wild Turkey 101 is a richly-flavoured concoction with a mellowness that belies its high strength.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Wild Turkey Rare Breed
Barrel Proof
description: Wild Turkey Rare Breed was upped in strength to 58.4% in 2018. Blended from barrels of six to 12-year-old bourbon and bottled at barrel proof with no added water, Rare Breed has a rich, yet mellow flavour despite its high alcohol content.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Wild Turkey 81 Proof Bourbon
description:
An 81 proof (40.5%ABV) bourbon crafted by Wild Turkey associate distiller Eddie Russell, son of master distiller Jimmy. It's a high rye mash matured in heavily charred casks for big flavour at a more approachable ABV than the 101.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon

name: Wild Turkey Russell's Reserve Rye
description: A spicy single barrel Russel's Reserve rye whiskey from Wild Turkey, it offers notes of vanilla, tobacco and spicy pepper over a background of freshly-mown grass.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Wild Turkey Rye
description:
From the ever-dependable Wild Turkey operation comes one of the best straight rye whiskies around. Now at a new strength of 40.5%.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Wild Turkey Russell's Reserve Rye 6 Year Old
description: An elegant rye from the folks at Wild Turkey, introduced in 2007 and popular since day one. Using a char level of 4 for their barrels (one of the heaviest), this is named after and hand selected by, master distiller Jimmy Russell and his son Eddie. This works well in an Old Fashioned.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Wildcatter 8 Year Old
description: A balanced eight-year-old bourbon with notes of caramel, vanilla, red fruits, apricots and spice. Wildcatter is made in homage to a short-lived bourbon label created by a notorious Texas oil baron who was known as the 'king of the wildcatters'.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Wilderness Trail Settlers Select Barrel Proof Rye
(58%)
description: A spicy rye whiskey from Wilderness Trail, made with a classic sweet mash and matured in a single barrel. Fruity aromas of ice cream, lemon curd, peppery spice and vanilla custard fill the nose. The palate offers notes of tobacco, dark chocolate, chilli flakes, orange peel and oak char that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Wilderness Trail Bottled In Bond Single Barrel Bourbon
description: A single barrel bourbon from Wilderness Trail, made with a high wheat mash bill and matured in virgin oak casks for at least five years, before being bottled in bond. The palate offers notes of buttery popcorn, toffee, caramel, cinnamon French toast and a hint of salt.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Willett's Pot Still Reserve Single Barrel Bourbon
Magnum
description: A big still shaped decanter of Kentucky Bourbon Distiller's excellent Willett Pot Still reserve. A small batch bourbon named for the founders of the distillery.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Willett's 4 Year Old Family Reserve Rye
description: A small-batch rye whiskey from Willet's, matured for four years in a handful of specially-selected casks. Layered aromas of cherry tart, cinnamon, baking spices and oak fill the nose. The palate offers notes of black cherries, burnt vanilla, baking spices and green rye.
subtitle: Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Woodford Reserve Double Oaked
description:
An interesting twist on Woodford Reserve's classic straight bourbon. The whiskey is first matured in new charred white oak barrels, as usual, but before bottling is transferred to special heavily toasted, lightly charred finishing barrel. This gives it quite a different flavour to normal, with lots of spicy oak coming through on the palate.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Woodford Reserve Distiller's Select
description:
Woodford Reserve is a superbly smooth, flavoursome bourbon, rich and full bodied with a sophisticated range of flavours. Excellent as a digestif after a rich meal.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Woodford Reserve Rye Whiskey
description:
Released in 2015, Woodford Reserve Rye is only the third expression in the core range. 53% of the mashbill is rye, leading to notes of apple and sweet spice.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey

name: Woodford Reserve Malt
description: A malt whiskey for bourbon drinkers, Woodford Reserve Malt is made with 51% malted barley and is matured in virgin American oak barrels. Aromas of caramel-covered hazelnuts, milk chocolate, apples and pineapple mingle with baking spices, oaky vanilla and mint on the nose. The palate offers notes of dark chocolate, caramel, toasted hazelnuts, cocoa powder, coconut and lively oak spice that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Malt Whiskey

name: Wyoming Small Batch
description: A small-batch traditional bourbon from Wyoming Whiskey that has aromas of summer flowers, vanilla bean and caramel pudding on the nose. The palate offers notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, browned butter, wild flowers, vanilla crème and caramel that linger in the finish, alongside hints of toffee and mint.
subtitle: Wyoming Bourbon Whiskey

name: Yellow Rose Premium American Whiskey
description: A smooth, sweet American whiskey from Yellow Rose Distilling, with notes of banana, caramel and vanilla throughout the palate.
subtitle: None

name: Yellow Rose Outlaw Bourbon
description: A bourbon from Yellow Rose distilling with a rebellious streak, Outlaw is made with 100% Texas yellow corn and is matured in small American oak barrels. The palate is full-bodied and warm, with notes of vanilla and caramel mingling with black pepper spice.
subtitle: None

name: Yellowstone Select
description: A hand-picked blend of sweet and spicy bourbons, Yellowstone Select is a classically-flavoured bourbon with plenty of character. On the nose there are notes of rye spice and sweet cherries, the palate brings rich, smoked caramel and finishes with brown sugar and oak flavours.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name:
Yellowstone Limited Edition
Bot.2018
description: A limited-edition bourbon from Yellowstone, bottled in 2018, it has been matured in virgin American oak casks and finished in ex-wine casks. Aromas of black cherries, autumn berries, cinnamon, molasses, vanilla and buttery biscuits fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of oak, baking spice, brown sugar, dried fruit and vanilla, with a hint of hazelnuts and citrus peel.
subtitle: Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Akashi Single Malt Whisky
description: Akashi Single Malt Whisky is made at the White Oak distillery in the Hyogo prefecture. Producing using lightly peated barley and aged in three different types of cask, this is the brand's flagship malt.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Chichibu On The Way
Bot.2019
description:
The 2020 release of Chichibu On The Way, matured in a secret combination of casks and bottled in 2019. Aromas of dried apricot, sultana, apple, pear, pineapple and coconut mingle with polished oak and honeysuckle on the nose. The palate offers notes of buttery pastry, stewed fruit, dried pineapple, melon and strawberry laces.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle:
Japanese Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Chichibu The Peated 2011
Bot.2015
description:
The 2011 vintage of Chichibu's sought-after peated whisky has been left for an extra year for this release. The strongest yet at a cask strength of 62.5%, this is big, bold and intensely smoky, with spice and sweetness – a complex whisky.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Chichibu 2012
Peated Single Cask #2089 TWE Exclusive
description: Single cask of peated spirit was distilled at Chichibu in 2012. Hand-selected by The Whisky Exchange for its rich and full texture, flavours of barbecue smoke and plum sauce, and its lingering finish.
subtitle:
Japanese Single Malt Whisky
Chichibu Distillery

name: The Chita Whisky
description: Chita is Suntory's grain distillery. The flagship release is aged in a combination of wine, sherry and bourbon casks. This is a light whisky with subtle notes of mint, honey and wood spice.
subtitle:
Japanese Single Grain Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Hakushu Distiller's Reserve
description:
A green and crunchy entry in the Hakushu Range, combining whisky of a wide variety of ages, from across the range of casks used by the distillery to create a gently smoky dram, packed with fruity flavour.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name: Hakushu 12 Year Old
description:
A perennial favourite and a must-try for anyone interested in discovering Japanese whisky. Hakushu is owned by Suntory, founders of the first Japanese distillery, Yamazaki. The original Hakushu distillery was built in 1973, with another distillery building called Hakushu Higashi (east) added in 1981.

Tasting Notes (3)
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name: Hakushu 18 Year Old
description:
A massive step up in quality from the standard Hakushu 12 yrs, this 18yo is amazingly well-defined (as we've come to expect from Japanese whisky) with deliciously rounded fruit and cereal flavours, at times surprisingly reminiscent of the finest Irish potstill whisky (eg Redbreast 15yo).

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name: Hakushu 10 Year Old
description: A younger expression of Hakushu, this well-mannered 10yo represents one of the gentlest introductions to the elegant, impeccably-constructed qualities of Japanese malt whisky.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Hanyu 1985 The Joker
Monochrome Label
description: The last and final release from the Ichiro's Malt Card series bottlings from the closed Hanyu distillery. The Joker "Monochrome", perhaps is the rarest and most sought after from this legendary series.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Hanyu
The Joker Colour Label
description:
The eagerly-anticipated final release from the Ichiro's Malt Card series bottlings from the closed Hanyu distillery. This is a vatting of six vintages (1985, 1986, 1988, 1990, 1991 and 2000) from a total of seven types of cask (chibidaru, bourbon, Madeira, hogshead, Cognac, puncheon and sherry butt).

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Ichiro's Malt & Grain
Japanese Blended Whisky 2021
description: The limited-edition 2021 release of Ichiro's Malt & Grain Japanese blended whisky from the ever-popular Chichibu is a fruity, complex whisky with notes of dried fruit, juicy plums, baking spices and peppery oak throughout the palate.
subtitle: Japanese Blended Whisky

name:
Ichiro's Malt & Grain
Japanese Blended Whisky 2019
description: A blended whisky from the king of independent Japanese distillers, Ichiro Akuto, bottled in 2019. The nose is full of citrus and peach aromas, with wafts of vanilla in the background, while the palate offers notes of caramel and toasted oak as well.
subtitle:
Japanese Blended Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Kaiyo Mizunara Oak Cask Strength
description: This is cask-strength edition of Kaiyo's Mizunara matured whisky. It's a rare beast, as there's not much Mizunara – Japanese oak – and only a tiny amount gets turned into whisky casks. It's worth the effort, as it adds a distinctly Japanese edge to the whisky, layering on incense-laden spiciness. Kaiyo go even further, shipping their casks out to sea for months before bottling to give them a gentle rock on the waves, getting even more flavour out of the wood.
subtitle: Japanese Blended Malt Whisky

name: Kaiyo Mizunara Oak
description: Kaiyo's stock of Mizunara oak casks is its pride and joy. Known to impart a subtle and unusual collection of aromas and flavours to whisky during maturation, it's this wood which is often credited with setting Japanese whisky apart. Kaiyo doubles down on its cask maturation, sending the full casks off to sea for months at a time, allowing the natural motion to ensure constant movement, and thus contact between whisky and wood.
subtitle: Japanese Blended Malt Whisky

name: Kaiyo Peated Mizunara Oak
description: A fruity, zesty and softly-smoky Japanese whisky, matured in mizunara oak casks. Aromas of orange peel, jasmine, soft cedar and coastal air fill the nose. The palate offers notes of earthy coffee, green apples, black tea and fresh herbs, with hints of cinnamon pastries and mango that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Japanese Blended Malt Whisky

name:
Karuizawa 34 Year Old Cask #3668
Ruby Geisha
description: The younger half of the Ruby Geishas – the penultimate release in the Karuizawa Geisha series – this 34-year-old release is exclusive to The Whisky Exchange and being sold by ballot. It was matured in a single sherry butt and its time in cask have given it a rich and complex character with layers of sherry-oak and spice.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Karuizawa 38 Year Old Cask #7582
Ruby Geisha
description: The older of the Karuizawa Geisha pair – the penultimate release in the Karuizawa Geisha series – this 38-year-old whisky was matured in a sherry butt and shows off the classic character of the lost Japanese distilleries famed whiskies: a careful balance of sweet and savoury notes, run through with dark oak and spice. Due to the limited number of bottles available, this is being sold by ballot.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Karuizawa 31 Year Old
Sapphire Geisha
description:
A 31-year-old Karuizawa single malt, matured in a single sherry cask for more than three decades before being bottled by Elixir Distillers exclusively for The Whisky Exchange's Karuizawa Geishas series. The bottle features a label designed by our creative director Raj Chavda, paying homage to the exquisite, inaccessible beauty of the meiko on her way to become geisha.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Karuizawa 38 Year Old
Pearl Geisha
description:
Bottled by Elixir Distillers, this 38-year-old Karuizawa single malt is currently the oldest whisky in the prestigious Geisha series.


One half of the exquisite Pearl Geisha duo, this was aged in sherry cask no. 4348 and filled into just 172 bottles at 62.1% ABV.


The Geisha series was created to pay homage to both the exquisite whiskies of the closed Karuizawa distillery, and the majesty of its surrounding culture. As with the rest of the series, the Pearl Geisha labels were designed by The Whisky Exchange’s creative director Raj Chavda, who is also a fellow of the Royal Society of Art.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Karuizawa 1984
Bot.2014 Sherry Cask #3657
subtitle:
Japanese Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Karuizawa 1983
Bot.2014 Sherry Cask
description: This 1983 Karuizawa has spent its life in first-fill sherry casks and was bottled in 2014 for a private customer.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Karuizawa 1981
Bot.2014 Sherry Cask
description: Whiskies from Karuizawa are some of the most sought after in the world. Not only has the distillery closed, but its heavily sherried drams have a reputation for excellence that has only grown over the past few years. This 1981 sherry-cask-matured dram was previewed at The Whisky Show 2014, where it went down a storm.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Karuizawa 1984
29 Years Old Sherry Cask #3662
description: This sherry-matured Karuizawa was a joint bottling between The Whisky Exchange and Japanese company Shinanoya. Distilled in 1984 and aged for 29 years, 271 bottles were produced at 61%.
subtitle:
Japanese Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Karuizawa 30 Year Old
First Geisha Bourbon Cask #8606
description: A contrast to its companion 31yo sherried release, this Karuizawa 30 year old has been matured solely in bourbon casks. A break from the distillery's usual character and one of only a handful of similar releases – intense and showing another side of this closed, cult distillery.
subtitle:
Japanese Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Karuizawa 1984
Bot.2013 Sherry Cask #3663
description:
A great single cask bottling from closed Karuizawa - distilled in 1984, matured in sherry cask #3663 and bottled in 2013. Big, rich and packed with sherry fruit.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle:
Japanese Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Karuizawa 1981
Sherry Cask #6056
description:
An incredibly intense 1981 vintage bottling from cult closed Japanese distillery Karuizawa. Aged in a sherry cask for more than 30 years, this is another excellent example from this legendary distillery – it might just be the best one that we've bottled.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle:
Japanese Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Karuizawa 1981
Cask #103
description:
A bottling of Cask No. 103 from the tiny Karuizawa distillery, which uses small stills, wooden washbacks and sherry casks to produce a quality malt. This is the oldest expression we have seen so far from this distillery and has been extremely popular. One of only 10 Gold Medal-winners at the Malt Maniac's Awards 2007.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Matsui Sakura
Kurayoshi Distillery
description: A Japanese single malt from Kurayoshi Distillery, Matsui Sakura has been matured in casks made from cherry wood and featuring artwork by Kikukawa Eizan on the label, entitled "Beauty in the Cherry Blossom Garden". Aromas of cherry blossom, almonds, orange and melon fill the nose, complemented by notes of baking spices, orange zest, malt, vanilla sponge, honeysuckle and more cherry blossom throughout the palate.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Mars Komatgatake Edition
Bot.2021
description: The 2021-edition of Mars Komagatake Japanese single malt, distilled at the famous Shinshu distillery, is a fruity, floral whisky with notes of melted milk chocolate, honeysuckle, cherry blossom, vanilla, peaches and grapes throughout the palate.
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name: Miyagikyo Single Malt
description:
Nikka's entry-level whisky from Miyagikyo distillery. Light in body, yet full of flavour, this is an excellent introduction to Japanese whisky. Elegantly fruity with sherry-cask character.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle:

name: Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky
description:
A release of grain whisky from Japan's Nikka, produced mainly from corn using one of their continuous Coffey stills. Rather than the rare and limited releases they have done before, this is a larger release to further show off this key component in the Nikka family of whiskies.

description: A limited-edition single malt from Nikka's Miyagikyo distillery, bottled in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the wedding of Nikka Founder Masataka Taketsuru and Rita Cowan. Finished in casks that previously held apple brandy for more than 28 years, this is a bright, sweet whisky with notes of apples, pineapple upside-down cake, cinnamon, caramel and sweet oak spice.

name:
Shizuoka Single Malt Prologue K and Prologue W
2x20cl
description: A pair of Japanese single malts from Shizuoka Distillery, an up-and-coming distillery that repurposed equipment from the now-closed Karuizawa distillery. Prologue K was made in an ex-Karuizawa still and matured in first-fill bourbon casks, creating notes of white peaches, vanilla, white pepper and fennel seeds throughout the palate. Prologue W was made using a wood-fired still, know as Pot Still W, and matured in ex-bourbon casks, creating notes of honey, apples, apricots, lemon sponge cake and delicate smoke that linger in the finish.
subtitle:
Single Malt Japanese Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Suntory Toki
description:
Toki is a blended whisky from Suntory's three distilleries: Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita. This is a round and sweet blend with a refreshing citrus character and a spicy finish.


'Toki' means 'time' in Japanese. Toki has a different composition to its sister blend, Suntory Hibiki, and its main components are Hakushu single malt and Chita grain whisky.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle:
Japanese Blended Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Suntory Torys Classic
description: Suntory Torys Classic is a light and easy-drinking Japanese spirit. Due to being below 40% abv, this cannot be called a whisky in the EU, but is still made from a blend of malt and grain.
subtitle:
Japanese Blended Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Suntory Hibiki Harmony
description:
Hibiki Japanese Harmony is a blend of Japanese malt and grain whiskies from Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita. Presented in the brand's trademark 24-faceted bottle representing the Japanese seasons, this is light, approachable and moreish with enticing notes of orange peel and white chocolate.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle:
Japanese Blended Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Suntory Hibiki 17 Year Old
description:
A fantastic Japanese blend, made with aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's three distilleries. Spicy and sophisticated, this is great for catching people out at blind tastings. Recently awarded a Gold 'Editor's Choice' award from Whisky Magazine and picked up the top prize in its category at the World Whisky Awards 2010.

Tasting Notes (5)
subtitle: Japanese Blended Whisky

name: Suntory Hibiki 21 Year Old
description:
Another hit for Suntory, this Hibiki 21 merited 93 points from Jim Murray in 2009, while Dr. Whisky called it 'Unbelievably balanced, and dangerously drinkable.'


Please note


There are two different styles of box for this product and we cannot guarantee which version customers will receive.
subtitle: Japanese Blended Whisky

name:
The House of Suntory Triology Pack
3x20cl
description:
Explore the spirits of the House of Suntory with this Suntory Trilogy set. The trilogy includes Haku vodka, Roku gin and Toki whisky, showing off why Suntory is popular for more than just its whisky.


Haku Japanese vodka is distilled from Hakumai – 100% pure Japanese white rice – to create ‘Jyunpaku’ – pure and brilliant vodka. Filtered through bamboo charcoal, this spirit has a soft, subtly sweet taste with richer, grain notes.


Roku means 'six' in Japanese and refers to the six local, seasonal botanicals which complement eight traditional gin botanicals (juniper berries, coriander, lemon peel, etc) and give this spirit a distinctly Japanese character.


Toki is a blended whisky from Suntory's three distilleries: Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita. This is a round and sweet blend with a refreshing citrus character and a spicy finish.
subtitle: Suntory

name: Yamazaki 12 Year Old
description:
One of the first Japanese single malts to break into the UK market, Suntory's Yamazaki 12 Year Old continues to impress with its well-balanced fruity sweetness, something that appeals to novice and experienced whisky drinkers alike.

Tasting Notes (3) 

Yamazaki 12 year Old is a pioneering malt in Japan, for which Suntory deserve great credit. In its early days, it was rounded and delicate...now it is more intense, confident and elegant. 8/10. Michael Jackson, Whisky Magazine, Oct 2002
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name: Yamazaki Distiller's Reserve
description:
A fresh and fruity whisky from Yamazaki, full of red fruit and a touch of sherry cask. It's also got some mizunara (Japanese oak) matured whisky in the mix, which comes through as a complex spicy and almost incense-like note. A well put together and deep dram.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name: Yamazaki 18 Year Old
description:
A wonderful example of what Japanese whisky is capable of. We absolutely love this. Extremely smooth, with great complexity and a lovely balance of fruit, silky malt and a touch of smoke.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle: Japanese Single Malt Whisky

name:
Yamazaki Mizunara 18 Year Old
2017 Edition
description:
An incredibly rare and sought-after release from pioneering Japanese distiller Yamazaki. Created by master blender Shinji Fukuyo using Yamazaki’s decades of experience with mizunara – Japanese oak – and whiskies from 18 to 50 years of age, this very limited release showcases the wood’s unique effect on maturing spirit. Layers of exotic spices and incense notes mingle with fruit: a masterclass in Japanese whisky.

Tasting Notes (1) 

“I wanted to reveal the whisky’s soul that is the Art of Mizunara — a heightened sense and awakened palate engaged through aromas and flavors never known before. Encountering it should be a moment of epiphany.”. Shinji Fukuyo, Chief Blender, Suntory
subtitle:
Japanese Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Yoichi Single Malt
description:
Relaunched in 2016, this comes from Nikka's excellent Yoichi distillery. This is a blend of single malts from different years and consequently does not carry an age statement. This is a smoky whisky with a maritime character.

Tasting Notes (1)

name: Crown Royal Canadian Whisky
description: Created to celebrate a visit from King George VI & Queen Elizabeth in 1939, Crown Royal is full-bodied, yet delicately smooth and creamy, with hints of oak and vanilla.

description:

The boxes have slightly ripped corners.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: Crown Royal Northern Harvest Rye
description: Crown Royal Northern Harvest Rye is made with 90% rye. This is gently spicy with soft pepper, vanilla and butterscotch notes.
subtitle: Canadian Blended Whisky

name: Forty Creek Double Barrel Reserve
description: Forty Creek Double Barrel Reserve sees the whisky finished in bourbon barrels from Kentucky. This has led to a whisky with a creamy texture; full of notes of vanilla, pecan and toasted spice.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: Forty Creek Copper Pot Reserve
description: Copper Pot Reserve is a richer and more intense version of the award-winning Barrel Select. This full-bodied whisky has notes of spice and marmalade.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: Forty Creek Confederation Oak Reserve
description: Released to celebrate Canada’s 1867 Confederation, this whisky is finished in new Canadian oak for two years. Expect aromas of maple, raisin, fig and praline, with a full-bodied palate of buttercream, pepper and walnut. A delicious spicy whisky.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: Glen Breton Ice 10 Year Old
description: A 10-year-old Canadian whisky from Glen Breton, Ice has been matured in casks from Jost Vineyards, Nova Scotia, that previously held its Ortega Icewine. The result is aromas of sticky toffee, pudding, ginger nut biscuits and lemongrass that fill the nose, complemented by notes of stem ginger, maple syrup, cappuccino, Applewood, nutmeg, peppery spice and hints of peat smoke.
subtitle: Canadian Single Malt Whisky

name:
Gooderham & Worts Little Trinity
17 Year Old
description:
A limited edition Canadian whisky bottled to commemorate the generosity of the distillery's founder, William Gooderham, who built a church next to his distillery so that his employees didn't have to pay the 'pay to pray' fees charged by churches elsewhere.


Gooderham's church was called Little Trinity and, fittingly, this whisky is a blend of three grains: corn, rye and wheat. The result is blissful layers of flavour, which range from green apple, menthol and apricot to cinnamon, toffee, oak and juniper. Sinfully good.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: JP Wiser's 18 Year Old
description: An 18-year-old Canadian whisky from JP Wiser's that offers notes of autumn flowers, green apples, pine needles, caramel and oak spice throughout the palate.
subtitle: Canadian Blended Whisky

name:
JP Wiser's 1998 Ex Libris Smaller Hero
22 Year Old
description: A 1998 JP Wiser's Canadian whisky from French bottler La Maison du Whisky, Smaller Hero was matured in seasoned oak for 22 years, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Ex Libris series. Aromas of wood varnish, old books, heather honey, apricot stones, raspberry, salted caramel and prunes fill the nose, complemented by notes of cinnamon, freshly-grated ginger, coconut, coffee, liquorice, caramel, biscuits, rose petals, candied orange, pineapple and marzipan throughout the palate.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name:
JP Wiser's Dissertation
Rare Cask Series
description: The next instalment in JP Wiser's limited release – and aptly-named – Rare Cask series. A rye-forward profile and a 46.1% ABV provide this whisky a thick, punchy profile full of sweet cereal flavours, rich toffee, plenty of oak spice and big clouds of airy vanilla floating overhead.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: JP Wiser's 10 Year Old Triple Barreled
description: A blend of 10-year-old Canadian whiskies made in three barrel types: new oak, ex-bourbon and Canadian rye whisky. Wiser's 10 Year Old Triple Barrel is smooth and full-bodied with notes of rye spice.
subtitle: Canadian Blended Whisky

name: Lot 40 Rye
description:
Another small-batch blend of fine rye whiskies distilled in a small copper pot still, this is a characterful, robust, smoky whisky with a pleasingly sweet palate.


Lot 40 is made at Hiram Walker Distillery in Canada, one of the largest spirits producers in North America.
subtitle: Canadian Rye Whisky

name:
Pike Creek 10 Year Old
Rum Finish
description: Pike Creek is regarded by many as among the best Canadian whiskies on the market. Now available in the UK after many years' absence, this 10 year old is finished in rum barrels.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: Royal Canadian Small Batch
description: A small-batch blended Canadian whisky that offers aromas of green apples, apricots, banana splits and peppery grains that fill the nose. The palate holds notes of soft oak, maple syrup, peppery grains and tropical fruit that fade to vanilla sponge and honey lingering in the finish.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: Signal Hill Whisky
description: While Canadian whisky is often a showcase of different grains, Signal Hill focuses instead on casks. The distillery takes corn and malt spirit and ages them in three types of cask – ex-bourbon, ex-Canadian whisky and new oak. The three casks bring out different aspects of the whisky's character – vanilla and toffee notes, sweet grain and oaky spice respectively – creating a flavoursome and well-balanced whisky.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: Stalk & Barrel Red Blend Canadian Whisky
description: Described as 'the quintessential Canadian whisky' by GQ Magazine, this blend of aged single malt, aged rye and a touch of aged corn is a memorably full-bodied dram that's full of honey, granola, cacao, vanilla, cigar box and oak spice flavours. A worthy addition to your whisky cabinet.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: Stalk & Barrel Blue Blend Canadian Whisky
description: From a micro-distillery just north of Toronto comes this rounded, creamy blend of single malt, rye and corn whiskies. A fantastic mix of vanilla, crème brûlée, spice and fruit flavours, which gets more rounded and creamier with water.
subtitle: Canadian Whisky

name: Abasolo Mexican Corn Whisky
description: Made with 100% Mexican Cacahuazintle corn, Abasolo is a rich, complex Mexican corn whisky, matured in virgin oak casks. The palate offers notes of honey, black tea, vanilla, leather and roasted corn fill the palate.
subtitle:
Mexican Corn Whiskey 
Distillery Bottling

name:
Aber Falls Whisky
2021 Release
description: The autumn 2021 release of Aber Falls single malt Welsh whisky is a fruity, spicy single malt from the first whisky distillery in North Wales in over 100 years. Aromas of vanilla, toffee, candied orange, fig, sultana and clove fill the nose, complemented by notes of sherry-soaked raisins, forest fruits, dried fruit, creamy malt, walnuts and dark chocolate throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Single Malt Welsh Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
The E&K 5 Year Old Malt Whisky
 Indian & Scotch Fusion
description:
The E&K blended malt is a tribute to Victor Alexander Bruce, the 9th Earl of Elgin who became Viceroy of India in 1894. It was made in conjunction with independent bottlers Adelphi, whose Alex Bruce is the great-grandson of Victor Bruce.


This limited-edition whisky is a fusion of Scotch from Ardmore and Glenrothes, as well as malt from India's Amrut distillery. It has notes of tropical fruits, scented sandalwood, dark fruit, sweet smoke and Highland toffee, with a lingering and enjoyably complex finish.
subtitle: Blended Malt Scotch Whisky

name: Akashi Red
description: Akashi Red is made at the Eigashima (aka White Oak) distillery, which was founded in 1888. Produced by Akashi, this is a light and fruity whisky with notes of peach, almond and grape.
subtitle: World Blended Whisky

name: Akashi Blended Whisky
description: A lesser-known whisky outside the local Japanese market, this version of Akashi is specially produced for the European market using a mixture of Japanese and foreign-made malt and grain whisky to produce a reasonably priced everyday blend.
subtitle: World Blended Whisky

name: Alpenglow 2015 Version Française
description: A 2015 Alpengow single malt from independent bottler La Maison du Whisky that was initially matured in an ex0oloroso sherry cask and finished in a Pineau des Charentes barrel, before being bottled in 2021 as part of its Version Française series. Aromas of fresh straw, peat smoke, liquorice, sea salt, toffee, walnut, milk chocolate, heather honey, raisins black pepper and coffee fill the nose, complemented by notes of quince, rich peat smoke, dark chocolate, pistachio, strawberry, malted barley, pine needles and lime blossom throughout the palate.
subtitle: French Single Malt Whisky

name: Amaethon French Whisky
description: A French single malt from Amaethon that is made with French barley and has been matured for three years in oak casks. Aromas of malt, waffles, freshly-baked bread, honey, dried fruit, watermelon, green plum, gingerbread and cinnamon fill the nose, complemented by notes of dried fruit, oak spice, candied ginger, summer flowers, quince and banana throughout the palate.
subtitle: French Single Malt Whisky

name: Amahagan Yamazakura Wood Limited Edition
description: A fruity, floral blend of malts from the up-and-coming Nagahama distillery that has been finished in Yamazakura cherry wood casks. The palate offers notes of wild cherry blossom, sweet incense, orange peel and dark honey that linger in the finish.
subtitle:
World Blended Whisky
Nagahama

name:
Amahagan Edition No 3
Mizunara Finish
description: Amahagan World Malt Edition No.3 is a Japanese malt whisky from Nagahama distillery, that has been finished in Mizunara wood. Aromas of orchard fruits, juicy oranges, sweet caramel and fragrant oak fill the nose, complemented by notes of Terry's Chocolate Orange, dark chocolate and citrus throughout the palate.
subtitle:
World Blended Whisky
Nagahama

name:
Amahagan Edition No 2
Red Wine Finish
description: The second release of Amahagan World Malt from Nagahama Distillery in Japan, Edition No.2 has been finished in ex-red wine casks. Aromas of sweet malt, digestive biscuits, raisins, plums, strawberries and raspberries fill the nose, complemented by notes of cranberries, toasted oak, cherries, cinnamon, black pepper and floral honey throughout the palate.
subtitle:
World Blended Whisky
Nagahama

name:
Amahagan Edition No 1
Blended Malt Whisky
description: Amahagan World Malt Edition No.1 is the first release in a series of three world blended whiskies from Japan's Nagahama distillery. Aromas of milk chocolate, orange, vanilla and roast nuts fill the nose, complemented by notes of apple, honey, malt, clove-studded oranges and oaky vanilla.
subtitle:
World Blended Whisky
Nagahama

name: Amrut Fusion
description:
Amrut Fusion gets its name from the fact that it uses two barleys: Indian and Scottish - with the latter being peated for good measure. Fusion has been picking up awards ever since it first appeared in 2009, and in 2012 was named the best whisky for a Rob Roy in the Ultimate Cocktail Challenge in New York.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name: Amrut Spectrum 004
description: The September 2021-bottling of Amrut Spectrum 004 was initially matured in ex-bourbon barrels before being aged in specially-made casks, formed of staves of virgin American oak, virgin French oak, oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. Aromas of dried fruit, Christmas pudding, coconut cream, vanilla, toffee and sandalwood fill the nose, complemented by notes of blackberry jam, soft spice, vanilla sponge, sultanas, cream, aromatic oak and a hint of smoke throughout the palate.
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name:
Amrut Single Malt
(46%)
description: Amrut's flagship Indian single malt, showing their signature character of spice, fruit and honey. Bottled at 46%, it has the depth of flavour needed to properly showcase the distillery. The original Indian single malt and, dare we say it, maybe the best?
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name: Amrut Peated Cask Strength
description:
From Amrut distillery, founded in 1948, just one year after Indian independence, this is a stormingly hot and spicy whisky, peated and bottled at a punchy cask strength of 62.8%.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name: Amrut Neidhal
description: The first release in Amrut's Single Malts of India series – a collection that showcases the hidden gem malts of India – Neidhal is a peated single malt from an undisclosed coastal distillery. Aromas of tropical fruits, vanilla, sea salt and soft phenols fill the nose, complemented by notes of fruit cocktail, vanilla, iodine, phenols and sea salt throughout the palate.
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name: Amrut Naarangi
description: Naarangi is an innovative release from India's Amrut. The name is Hindi for 'orange' and the whisky was aged in an ex-oloroso-sherry cask, which was then seasoned with wine and orange peel for three years. A three-year-old whisky was then finished in the cask for a further three years, producing a whisky with extra orangey notes.
subtitle:
Indian Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Amrut Peated Port Pipe 2013
6 Year Old
description: A single cask Indian single malt from Amrut that was matured in a single Port Pipe until it was bottled in August 2020. Aromas of oak and wood smoke, vanilla, white pepper and freshly-cut hay fill the nose, complemented by notes of orchard fruits, cracked pepper, honey, ashes, earthy smoke, damp leaves and cut grass throughout the palate.
subtitle: Single Malt Indian Whisky

name: Amrut Fusion X
description: Created in tribute to Amrut's late Chairman Neelakanta Rao Jagdaleand, Fusion X was also released to celebrate the 10th anniversary of Amrut Fusion Indian single malt. Initially matured in virgin oak and ex-bourbon casks, it was finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks, creating aromas of tropical fruits, salted caramel ice cream, almonds and vanilla that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of sweet oranges, pineapple, mango, dried fruit, vanilla ice cream, toffee and oak, with hints of peat smoke lingering in the finish.
subtitle: None

name: Amrut Triparva
description: Triparva is a limited-edition Indian single malt from Amrut, Triparva is a triple-distilled single malt that has aromas of salted caramel, coconut, vanilla, peach and sweet orange on the nose. The palate offers notes of vanilla custard, peach, melons, cream, orange and honey.
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name:
Amrut Greedy Angels 10 Year Old
Peated Rum Finish
description: A rich, smoky Indian single malt whisky from Amrut's Greedy Angels series, matured for 10 years and finished in an ex-rum cask, before being bottled in October 2019. Woody aromas mingle with smoky peat, sweet spice and marmalade on the nose, developing into sour cherry, cocoa and sweet vanilla. The palate offers notes of butterscotch, candied citrus fruit and tropical fruits, followed by camphor, soft smoke and rum-soaked raisins.
subtitle:
Single Malt Whisky
Amrut Distilleries

name:
Amrut Kadhambam
2019 Release Batch 15
description: The 2019 release in Amrut's series, Kadhambam means 'mixture' or 'combination', and this Amrut certainly lives up to its name: a vatting of normal and peated Amrut that started life in ex-oloroso casks before being transferred first into brandy casks, then into rum casks (both the rum and brandy having been produced at Amrut also). A curious mixture, but it works. This is a unique and thrilling whisky.
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name: Amrut Madeira Finish
description: A rich and multifaceted whisky aged primarily in ex-bourbon casks before a fairly lengthy finish in ex-Madeira casks sourced from family cooperages in Spain and Portugal. The finish has imbued Amrut's full-bodied spirit with sweet notes of honey and ripe, jammy orange rounded out by some oak-and-grapefruit bitterness and a touch of spice. A fantastic whisky bottled at a punchy 50% ABV.
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name: Amrut Raj Igala
description: Raj Igala (meaning ‘the king of eagles’) is made from Punjabi malted barley and was aged in ex-bourbon casks. Expect aromas of malt, liquorice and peat, with notes of pepper, cereal and oil. Another top-notch whisky from Amrut.
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name:
Amrut Double Cask
3rd Edition
description: The third edition of this popular bottling, which blends single malt aged in a bourbon cask with that aged in a sherry cask. The two combine to create delicious notes of chocolate, tobacco, raisins, peach, brown sugar and plum.
subtitle:
Indian Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Amrut Cask Strength
description: Continuing the run of impressive cask strength bottlings, this edition from Amrut clocks in at a pokey 61.8% and promises their usual balance of spice and fruit.
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name: Amrut Peated
description: The new 46% Amruts are a very different proposition to the pleasant but unexciting original release. At the higher strength this 24ppm peated effort fairly fizzes along the tastebuds. This is excellent - hugely improved stuff from a distillery coming along in leaps and bounds.
subtitle: Indian Single Malt Whisky

name: Armorik 10 Year Old
description: A 10-year-old French single malt from Armorik, matured initially in ex-bourbon casks, followed by oloroso sherry casks before being bottled in 2021. Aromas of pineapple, passionfruit, almond croissants and vanilla caramel fill the nose, complemented by notes of lively citrus zest, maple syrup, white pepper, mango and pineapple throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Single Malt French Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Armorik Classic
description:
Armorik's Classic is produced at the Warenghem distillery in Lannion in the north of Brittany and is a marriage of sherry and bourbon cask whiskies of various ages.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Distillery Bottling

name: Armorik Double Maturation
description:
An innovative malt from this Breton distillery. The whisky is aged first in Breton oak casks before being finished in sherry casks. This whisky has a real marine influence, which no doubt comes from the distillery's coastal location.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle:
French Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Armorik Yeun Elez Jobic
description: A well-balanced single malt from Armorik, named after the ancient peat bog located at the heart of the Armorica National Park.
subtitle: Single Malt French Whisky

name: Armorik Sherry Cask Single Malt
description:
From Brittany's first whisky distillery, Warenghem, comes this sherry-aged single malt, which takes Armorik's fruity spirit and adds extra layers of sweet dried fruits and spices.


Warenghem released the first Breton single malt in 1998, calling it the Armorik to reflect the name that the Brittany region was given by its Roman occupiers.
subtitle:
French Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Bain's Cape Mountain Whisky
description: Bain's is the first South African single grain whisky, made in Wellington at the James Sedgwick distillery. Bain's has made an impressive debut in the UK, picking up a Gold Medal at the International Wine & Spirits Competition in 2010 and a Silver at the International Spirits Competition before crowning that with the title of World's Best Grain Whisky at the World Whisky Awards.
subtitle: Single Grain South African Whisky

name:
Bakery Hill Batch 1
5 Year Old TBWC Australian Series
description: A smoky Bakery Hill Australian single malt from That Boutique-y Whisky Company that was matured in an ex-bourbon cask for five years. This peated Australian whisky offers aromas of sweet peat, green banana, medicinal herbs and a touch of vanilla on the nose and echoed throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Single Malt Australian Whisky
That Boutique-y Whisky Company

name: Bakery Hill Peated
description:
A peated whisky from Bakery Hill distillery located just outside the Australian city of Melbourne. Earthy and smoky with notes of kumquat and tobacco.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Australian Single Malt Whisky

name: Bakery Hill Classic
description:
Bakery Hill Classic comes from just outside Melbourne in Australia. The flagship of the range, this has notes of nutmeg, honey and an underlying maltiness.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Australian Single Malt Whisky

name: Bakery Hill Double Wood
description:
Bakery Hill Double Wood is distilled in Bayswater, Victoria, Australia. Aged initially in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, it's finished in French oak. Sweet with notes of marmalade and nougat.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Australian Single Malt Whisky

name: Bankhall Sweet Mash
description: A Bourbon-inspired English single grain whisky from Bankhall distillery in Blackpool, made with a sweet mash of corn, rye and malted barley, and matured exclusively in virgin American oak casks. Aromas of vanilla custard and toasted coconut fill the nose, complemented by notes of honey-covered cornbread, baked apples with soft brown sugar and lashings of cream throughout the palate.
subtitle: English Single Grain Whisky

name: Bastille 1789 Single Malt
description: A single malt whisky from Bastille, a French brand from Jean-Marc Daucourt, creator of Jean-Marc Vodka. Made entirely with malted barley from north-eastern France and aged in a variety of casks including Limousin oak, this has hints of sweetness and smoke.
subtitle: French Single Malt Whisky

name: Bastille 1789 Blended
description: Bastille Whisky is a French brand from Jean-Marc Daucourt, creator of Jean-Marc Vodka. The blended whisky is made with barley and wheat from north-eastern France and aged in a variety of casks including Limousin oak. Rich and full bodied with notes of orange and pepper.
subtitle: French Blended Whisky

name: Beverbach Single Malt Whiskey
description: Beverbach Single Malt Whiskey from Germany's Hardenberg distillery is made with a combination of malted barley and malted wheat, unlike single malt whiskies from Scotland. Initially matured in first-fill bourbon casks, before being finished in casks that previously held brandy, creating a layer of dried fruit and honey notes on the palate, as well as nuts, vanilla baking spices and burnt toast.
subtitle:
Single Malt German Whiskey
Hardenberg Distillery

name: Beverbach Single Malt Tequila Finish
description: A German single malt from Hardenberg Distillery, this limited-edition Beverbach whisky was initially matured in first-fill bourbon and brandy casks, before being finished for six months in ex-Tequila casks. Aromas of green oak, bitter herbs, caramel and dark fruits fill the nose, complemented by notes of green apples, crunchy pears, malty biscuits, peppery oak, earthy spice, vibrant lemon zest and green herbs throughout the palate.
subtitle: Single Malt German Whiskey

name:
Bimber Oloroso Cask
Batch 2
description:
The second batch of Bimber's Oloroso Cask release was matured initially in first-fill bourbon barrels before being finished in oloroso-sherry casks. Exclusive to the UK, this is silky intexture with notes of banana, and roasted pineapple.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle:
Single Malt English Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Bimber Recharred Cask Single Malt Whisky
Batch 1
description:
The second-ever single malt whisky released by west London's Bimber distillery has been matured in re-charred American oak casks. The barrels were hand charred by Bimber's own cooper in London, and laid down in 2016, creating a sweet, rich whisky with aromas of orchard fruits, roasted pineapple, honey, nougat and oak, as well as hints of cinnamon and pepper. The palate offers notes of red apples, juicy pears, banana bread, pineapple juice, caramel, butterscotch and vanilla pods, on top of a layer of pepper, ginger and charred oak.


Bimber is based in West London and is one of a number of exciting new English distilleries, releasing its first single malt in 2019.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle:
Single Malt English Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Bimber Ex-Bourbon Single Malt Whisky Batch 1
description: A small-batch bourbon cask matured single malt from west London distillery Bimber, made with a combination of American oak ex-bourbon casks and bottled in May 2020. Aromas of green apples, dried peaches, milky cereal and vanilla sponge cake fill the nose alongside hints of desiccated coconut and buttery toast. The palate offers notes of baked apples and apricots, lively pepper, charred oak and creamy vanilla.
subtitle:
Single Malt English Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Bimber Apogee XII
12 Year Old
description: A blend of malt whiskies sourced in Scotland, then further aged Bimber distillery in West London. After blending, Apogee undergoes a short finish in casks previously used to mature the highly sought-after Bimber single malt. The result is a honeyed and nutty, with notes of marmalade on malt loaf and toasty ginger biscuits.
subtitle: Malt Whisky

name: Bimber Peated Cask Batch 1
description: The first release of Bimber Peated Cask single malt has been matured in a combination of first-fill bourbon barrels and quarter casks that previously held peated Islay whisky. Aromas of ripe peach, toffee, vanilla cream, juniper and smoky tobacco fill the nose. The palate offers notes of stone fruits, lime zest, shortbread biscuits, charcoal and medicinal peat smoke that linger in the finish.
subtitle:
Single Malt English Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Bimber Whisky The First Release
description: The first single malt to be released by west London's Bimber distillery is a fruity, elegant whisky that has been matured in just five Pedro Ximénez casks for three years, before being bottled in 2019. The nose immediately offers notes of autumn berries, blackcurrant jam and rich fruitcake. The palate is full of rich sherry flavours; dark berries, ginger, cinnamon, dried fruits, orange and clove.
subtitle: Single Malt English Whisky

name:
Black Gate Batch 1 3 Year Old
TBWC Australian Series
description: The first batch of Black Gate Australian single malt from That Boutique-y Whisky Company is a three-year-old whisky that offers aromas of old, dusty books, red grapes, brown sugar and burnt caramel on the nose and echoed throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Single Malt Australian Whisky
That Boutique-y Whisky Company

name: Box Quercus Robur
description:
The first in a new series from the Swedish distiller which explores the effects of different oaks on whisky's ageing. This single malt has been matured in first-fill bourbon barrels for 4.1 years and then finished in new Swedish oak barrels for 7 months. This process has given the whisky, filled into 8,229 bottles, notable spicy and sweet flavours.


Quercus Robur is the Latin name for European oak, which grows across much of Sweden.
subtitle:
Swedish Single Malt Whisky 
Distillery Bottling

name: Box The 2nd Step Collection 03
description: A peated single malt from Sweden which represents the third and last edition in the 2nd Step Collection, a series which has explored the distillery's character and the depth of its young whiskies. Made from a marriage of bourbon casks, American oak casks and Hungarian oak casks, of which 88% of the whisky was peated to an average of 38.6 PPM, no.3 in the series is an enjoyably peaty dram with undertones of fruits, vanilla, wood spice and caramel.
subtitle:
Swedish Single Malt Whisky 
Distillery Bottling

name: Box Dalvve
description: Dálvve is a medium-peated whisky that has been aged for around five years in first-fill bourbon casks. This is a sweet and smoky whisky with notes of vanilla.
subtitle:
Swedish Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Box American Oak
description: Box American Oak is a peated whisky that was aged for around four-and-a-half years in bourbon casks before being finished for eight months in small charred virgin American-oak casks. The result is a toasty and spicy whisky.
subtitle:
Swedish Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Box The Explorer
description: The Explorer is the third release in Box's The Early Days Collection. Made mainly using malt peated to around 40ppm, this has been predominantly matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished in medium-toasted Swedish oak. Fruity and sweet with a smoky backbone
subtitle:
Swedish Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Box Early Days 002
description: Made with Pilsner malt, of which two-thirds is peated and aged for more than four years, this is the second batch of Early Days from Sweden's Box. Matured in bourbon casks, this is rich and warming with notes of vanilla and smoke.
subtitle:
Swedish Single Malt Whisky 
Distillery Bottling

name: Box Early Days 001
description: Batch 001 of Box's Early Days is an unpeated whisky aged in bourbon casks. The result is a whisky which combines vanilla and herbaceous flavours.
subtitle:
Swedish Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Box Advanced Master Class
Course 1 Toasting 5x20cl
description: Sweden's Box have created the Advanced Master Class series. The first 'course' contains five 20cl bottles of the same spirit, each with a different toasting level to highlight the effect this has on the finished whisky. Further courses are planned including different yeasts and warehouse temperatures.
subtitle: Swedish Malt Spirit

name:
Brenne Estate Cask French Single Malt
 Cognac Finish
description: An unusual dram from France, twice distilled in the copper alembic stills normally used in Cognac production. The Cognac theme is further continued in the whisky's aging process, as after a period of maturation in new Limousin oak barrels it is then finished in Cognac casks. The result is a single malt with intense notes of apricot, banana, rose, vanilla and bubblegum. One for those with a sweeter tooth.
subtitle:
French Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Cardrona Growing Wings
 Central Otago Pinot Noir Cask
description: A single cask release of Growing Wings single malt from Cardona Distillery in New Zealand that was matured in a single Central Otago Pinot Noir cask for five years, and bottled in September 2021. Aromas of honey-drizzled apricots, figs and sweet balsamic fill the nose, complemented by notes of sun-ripened nectarines, fresh strawberries and clotted cream throughout the palate.
subtitle: None

name:
Cardrona Growing Wings
Old Forester Bourbon Cask
description: A fruity New Zealand single malt from Cardrona, this single cask Growing Wings release has been matured in a single Old Forester bourbon cask for five years and was bottled at cask strength in September 2021. Aromas of caramelised apple and freshly-cut hay fill the nose, complemented by notes of sunburnt apricots, pear, clover honey and vanilla cream.
subtitle: Distillery Bottling

name:
Cardrona Growing Wings 5 Year Old
Breckenridge Bourbon Cask
description: A milestone five-year-old malt from Cardrona on New Zealand’s South Island. This single cask release was drawn from a Bourbon barrel filled during the distillery’s first year of operation. It’s a rich, buttery dram with lots of American oak vanilla on the nose and stewed pears on the palate.
subtitle:
Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Cardrona Growing Wings 5 Year Old

Oloroso Sherry Cask
description: A single cask whisky from New Zealand distillery Cardrona, celebrating five years since the distillery laid down its first spirit. Bottled from a single oloroso sherry butt, Growing Wings is a sweet whisky with notes of honey, sweet flowers and cream.
subtitle:
Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Castan-Vilanova 2017
3 Year Old Version Française
description: A 2017 Castan-Villanova single malt French whisky from Version Francais that spent time in an ex-white wine cask. Aromas of sweet almonds, summer flowers and soft smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of old leather, grapefruit and dried flowers throughout the palate.
subtitle: Single Malt French Whisky

name: Cotswolds Signature Single Malt
description: A sweet and fruity English single malt from Cotswolds Distillery that is matured in a combination of STR ex-red wine casks and ex-bourbon casks. The palate offers notes of honey, Seville orange, marmalade and dark red fruits that linger in the finish.
subtitle: English Single Malt Whisky

name: Cotswolds Sherry Cask Single Malt
description: A sherry cask matured English single malt from the Cotswolds Distillery that was aged in a combination of American and Spanish oak hogsheads and butts which have previously held either oloroso or Pedro Ximenez sherry. Aromas of brown sugar, cherry pie and roasted coffee beans fill the nose, complemented by notes of plums, chocolate, toasted almonds and peppery oak throughout the palate.
subtitle: English Single Malt Whisky

name:
Cotswolds Founder's Choice
(59.1%)
description: A cask-strength single malt from The Cotswolds Distillery, Founder's Choice is made with 100% locally-grown, floor-malted barley and is aged exclusively in STR ex-red wine casks – a favourite of the distillery's founder Daniel Szor. Aromas of dry hay, freshly-cut wood, dark chocolate, dried figs and plums in syrup fill the nose, complemented by notes of warm porridge, toast, butterscotch, dried fruit and fresh berries throughout the palate, with hints of roasted hazelnuts lingering in the finish.
subtitle:
English Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Cotswolds Reserve Single Malt
description: The elegant, refined Cotswolds Reserve single malt is a hand-crafted small batch English whisky made exclusives with locally grown floor-malted Cotswolds barley. Matured in a combination of first-fill ex-bourbon casks and STR ex-red wine casks, it offers notes of vanilla, honey, butterscotch, coconut, dried fruit, warm spice and hints of oak that fill the palate.
subtitle:
English Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Cotswolds 3 Year Old

Batch 1 That Boutique-y Whisky Company
description: The first-ever batch of Cotswolds English whisky from That Boutique-y Whisky Company is a fruity, nutty three-year-old with aromas of butterscotch, nectarines, apricots, Seville orange marmalade and ginger that fill the nose, complemented by notes of marzipan, cinnamon, nutmeg, toffee apples, pink grapefruit and caramelised plums throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Single Malt English Whisky
That Boutique-y Whisky Company

name:
Cotswolds Peated Cask
(60.2%)
description: A rich and fruity English single malt from Cotswolds distillery, matured in an ex-peated whisky quarter cask, creating a delicate smokiness throughout the palate.
subtitle: English Single Malt Whisky

name:
Cotswolds Peated Cask
(60.4%)
description: A subtly smoky English single malt from Cotswolds Distillery, made in small batches with 100% floor-malted local barley and matured in ex-peated whisky quarter casks. Rich notes of summer berries, apricot jam and earthy peat smoke mingle together on the palate.
subtitle: English Single Malt Whisky

name: Dartmoor Whisky Bourbon Cask
description: A sweet and creamy English single malt from Dartmoor Whisky that was made using locally-produced barley and matured in an American white oak ex-bourbon cask. The nose is all about vanilla, complemented by notes of toffee, crème brûlée, marshmallow and honey throughout the palate.
subtitle:
English Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Dartmoor Whisky Oloroso Sherry Cask
description: A fruity, nutty English single malt from Dartmoor Whisky that was made with locally-grown barley and matured in a single oloroso sherry cask from Jerez. The palate offers notes of sultanas, marzipan, hazelnuts, coconut, sweet sherry, gingerbread and treacle that linger in the finish and are echoed on the nose.
subtitle:
English Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Dartmoor Whisky Bordeaux Red Wine Cask
description: A fruit-forward English single malt from Dartmoor Whisky that is made with barley grown on Dartmoor National Park and matured in an ex-Bordeaux red wine cask. Soft, fruity aromas of blackcurrant and dried fruit fill the nose, complemented by notes of wine-gums, coconut, chocolate and honeysuckle throughout the palate.
subtitle:
English Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Domaine des Hautes Glaces
Les Moissons Organic Single Malt
description:
Les Moissons Single Malt is made using organic barley grown and malted on-site at Domaine des Hautes Glaces in the alpine region of south-east France. Matured in a combination of virgin oak casks and those which used to hold either Cognac or white wine.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: French Single Malt

name: Domaine des Hautes Glaces Ceros Single Rye Whisky
description: An organic single rye whisky from French distillery Domaine des Hautes Glaces that is made with 100% malted rye and matured in ex-wine casks. Aromas of peppery rye, seaweed, oranges, malt and caramelized walnuts fill the nose, complemented by notes of marzipan, chocolate ganache, liquorice, coffee, cardamom and candied fruit throughout the palate.
subtitle:
French Single Rye Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name:
Domaine Des Hautes Glaces 2016

Version Française
description: A 2016 Domaine Des Hautes Glaces from La Maison du Whisky's Version Francaise series, matured in a second-fill Saint Joseph cask. Aromas of lilies, nectarines, wax and honey fill the nose, complemented by notes of rich malt, white grapes, lemon, black pepper and raspberry throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Single Malt French Whisky
La Maison du Whisky

name: East London Liquor Co London Rye Whisky
description: A vibrant, spicy rye whisky from East London Liquor Co that is made in East London with a blend of 55% malted rye and 45% malted barley, and is matured in a combination of Hungarian oak, American oak, regenerated oak and ex-London brandy casks.
subtitle: English Rye Whisky

name:
East London Liquor Co & Sonoma Distilling Co Blend
Bot.2021
description: The 2021 release of East London Liquor Company's collaboration with Sonoma Distilling Co is a combination of London Rye Whisky and California Bourbon made with American corn, rye and wheat. Aromas of brandy-soaked cherries, peanut butter, chocolate, ice tea, apricots and cinnamon fill the nose, complemented by notes of fresh grass, honeysuckle, sweetcorn, leather and peanut butter throughout the palate.
subtitle: None

name:
East London Liquor Co London Rye Whisky
Bot.2020
description: The 2020 edition of East London Liquor Company's London Rye Whisky has been matured in a combination of different casks, including virgin French oak, chestnut, shaved-toasted-recharred, sherry and bourbon casks. The palate offers notes of candied orange peel, toffee apples, sour cherries and rich oak that linger in the finish alongside peppery spice.
subtitle: English Rye Whisky

name:
East London Liquor Co & Sonoma Distilling Co Blend
2019 Release
description: A collaboration between East London Liqueur Co. and Sonoma Distilling Company's Adam Spiegel, this London Rye whisky has been matured in a variety of casks, including ex-peated whisky casks and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. Aromas of honey, brandy-soaked cherries, almond butter, hay and honeysuckle fill the nose. The palate offers notes of black pepper, dried apricots, candied cherries, coffee and porridge.
subtitle: None

name:
East London Liquor Co Single Malt
Bot.2021
description: The 2021-release of East London Liquor Co single malt has been matured in a combination of casks, including red wine casks, ex-Sonoma Distilling Co rye whiskey casks, ex-Kentucky bourbon casks and more. The result is aromas of milk chocolate, peanut brittle, vanilla, raisins, juicy pineapple, oranges and oatcakes that fill the nose, complemented by notes of stewed apples, cloves, honey, shortcrust pastry, Szechuan peppers and cigar box throughout the palate.
subtitle:
English Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: East London Liquor Co Single Malt Whisky
description: A vibrant, bold English single malt from East London Liquor Co. that was matured in a combination of virgin American oak, ex-sherry and ex-Kentucky bourbon casks. The result is a lively character with notes of clove, ginger, banana and oak throughout the palate. Enjoy this on its own, over ice or as part of a flavourful cocktail.
subtitle: English Single Malt Whisky

name:
Eddu 2004
17 Year Old Single Cask
description: A 2004 Eddu French Buckwheat whisky, made at Distillerie des Menhirs in the Breton village of Plomelin and matured in a single cask for 17 years, before being bottled in August 2021. Aromas of vanilla, malt, garden herbs, stewed apple, coffee, banana and cinnamon fill the nose, complemented by notes of cocoa beans, coffee, toffee, salted caramel and nougat throughout the palate.
subtitle: French Buckwheat Whisky

name:
Eddu 2011
Version Française
description: A French whisky from Version Française, this 2011 Eddu whisky has been made from buckwheat and matured in an ex-Cognac cask to create aromas of apple, pancakes and redcurrants that fill the nose, complemented by notes of tarte tatin, ginger, Breton cake, cinnamon, almond and exotic fruit throughout the palate.
subtitle: French Buckwheat Whisky

name: The English 11 Year Old
description: The first single malt from The English Whisky Co to bear an age-statement, this milestone whisky has spent 11 years maturing in The English Whisky Co's warehouse. The palate is spicy and oaky, with notes of apple, cherries, tropical fruit, black pepper and ginger lingering in the finish.
subtitle: English Single Malt Whisky

name: The English Original Single Malt Whisky
description: The ongoing unpeated release from The English Whisky Co, Original is aged in bourbon casks, creating a whisky with notes of vanilla ice cream, nuts and a hint of sea spray.
subtitle: English Single Malt Whisky

name:
English Whisky Co. 2009
12 Year Old Watt Whisky
description: A 2009 English Whisky Co. single malt from independent bottler Watt Whisky that was matured in a first-fill ex-bourbon barrel for 12 years, before being bottled in 2022.
subtitle:
English Single Malt Whisky
Watt Whisky

name:
The English 2016
4 Year Old Virgin Oak & Sherry Cask Matured
description: Bottled just shy of its fifth birthday, this release from Norfolk's English Whisky Co. has been aged in a combination of virgin oak and ex-sherry casks. Distilled in December 2016 and bottled in November 2021, it has notes of chocolate orange and dried fruit.
subtitle:
English Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: The English Smokey Single Malt Whisky
